qELNtZhbkUB2_3tb2r6Ukg.text: I had the rare beef pho and the broth was amazing and the beef was lean and delicious. My husband had the beef stew pho and again delicious. The broth was a little thicker like stew soup but his beef was a little fattier. Still wonderful!

MvUD5n1Maxh1z1fMejg6Cg.text: This place doesn't even deserve one star. HORRIBLE service. Not to mention how filthy the place is (there were actual diners sitting eating with no shoes on). I had a menu thrown at me after ten minutes of not even being greeted followed by the woman leaving to go carry on a conversation with another Asian table. She came back and said to me "what you want" I can't even explain how incredibly rude and discourteous this is. After ordering a bowl of Pho and a pot of hot tea she walked away and came back ten minutes later and threw a plate of shriveled up soup condiments on the table and slammed down a plastic water cup of hot tea. At this point I asked "is this how you serve hot tea? Do you have a tea pot? A tea cup?" Her response was to wave her hand around and say "ya ya" and turn to talk to the other table again. I walked out. I will NEVER tell anyone to go there. I will NEVER GO BACK!! Customer service is key in this town and when you treat customers poorly they don't return. I won't be surprised when the place closes down.

5rXpU-yVekAtBt-8qsR7cw.text: Nice little spot I had lunch a few times. It's really good and depending on what you order you can eat very healthy.  The prices are reasonable, about $30 for 2 people to eat. I would recommend to friends to check it out.

EaUvDUntEGK8QysKdj-kWg.text: Food was legit, The staff was very cool, we got white boy love.

qMjGGqpUM520CVg_vdY0Jw.text: Firstly let me say I wish there was a 3.5 star rating on yelp. Because this place is def a 3.5. Not quite a 4 but not a 3 either. So I defaulted to 3. I grew up eating viet food in northern cali, so id like to think I know what good viet food is. Its starting to get pretty hot outside so Pho is out of the question,  so I decided to get some refreshing viet items. I had the shrimp and pork spring rolls and vermicelli w grilled pork and egg roll. Everything tasted good enough but felt as though could have been better. For instance the spring roll had great fillings big shrimp and freshly cooked noodles and lettuce but really lacked on the pork side. The vermicelli dish had alot of meat but had way too much vegetables for the amount of noodles I received. id say I received 50% meat, 35% veggies, and 15% noodles. The flavor of the meat was great, very tender not much fat *which is nice bec most of the time thit nuong is fatty* , most of this i could get past buuuuut the nuoc mam (fish sauce) that came with it was pretty bad. It was really sour, too sour, seemed like they needed to add more fish sauce and sugar to take the lemon bite down. Kinda killed the whole dish for me, as that is a staple thing in Bun. Hence why I leaned towards a 3 versus a 4. I think that it would be a great alternative to Chinatown for the southwest folks like myself, if they had a couple little tweaks. That being said having been to ALL the other Pho places in the southwest, Annie's the clear winner. Ill definitely be back to try their pho, but probably wont get any dish that requires nuoc mam.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun thit nuong and cha gio (vermicelli w grilled pork and egg rolls)
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their spring rolls are very fresh, but could have a bit more pork.

9MJlcSlVA67nu4uST7GWMw.text: The food is pretty good but not as good as the ones closer to Chinatown. I would usually just go here to get my pho fix since it's a close proximity to my home. The service is adequate & I never have any problems with having to wait for so long to receive any service. I also like the smaller environment because it doesn't seem as crowded as opposed to the ones in Chinatown which is something I personally like about the place.

kbr3ELRUJL2fTNpbNZsRlg.text: I've been at this place a few times with family or friends and I would say the dining has been agreeable. However, my wife and I were here kinda late last Saturday after watching a concert and we were told "closing  in 10 Min". So we decided to take out the food instead, but we were definitely disappointed to learn that they've only put like four small thinly slices of beef wrapped on clear plastic plus three small slices of tendon! We thought maybe they ran out of meat since they were closing or they're just skimpy on meat now that they have frequent customers! I've eaten at various Pho places and they are generous and reasonable with meat servings! Never going back that's for sure! Better to go at Bamboo Bistro!

nTzoJ99LkcOJBav1O-Bniw.text: Delicious. This place has authentic cuisine. I love it :) their bun reive is their down side. But the rice plates are huge portions and the pho satay is really good.

wjqkXSJ9DcR9WbP_RuGznA.text: I always go here for pho! It's one of the best in town, in my opinion.  I always get the rare steak and brisket pho, but since Phillip oh so raves about the Chicken Curry Noodle Soup,  I gave it a try.   I also ordered the rare steak pho and their chicken wings.  The pho is always as good as I remembered and less than $8 ! It is a total steal! The chicken curry soup was absolutely delicious!  It reminded me of home.  I don't think I have had it anywhere else in Vegas.  The soup was a bit thicker than the usual pho broth, but it tasted really good! There is a lot of chicken in the soup too, so it really helps you fill up.   The chicken wings are also delicious!  They are fried to perfection and topped with garlic butter sauce.  It's worth every penny !   The owners are also very nice! Make sure you guys give this place a try!

38PcEtmBrxwt4x0w9Z8IUQ.text: I am so happy and lucky that this place is literally 10 minutes from my house. Before I use to either go to Jenny pho or drive half an hour or more to get to china town for some good pho. Not any more, pho Annie has been here for I think more then a little under a year and a half but it is my go to spot.   The pho here is in my opinion way better then Jenny Pho. The flavor of the soup is always so good. The rest of the menu provides you with all your Vietnamese favorites and a wide verity of it too. The drinks are all good and they even serve fresh young coconut juice out a a coconut.   The Resturant is a bit small, it's a long narrow space and it can get a bit pack at times but it is worth it, and best of all Annie is always there and is always nice along with the rest of her staff. If you love pho and you are you haven't try Pho Annie and you are in the SW part of Las Vegas you must come here you won't be disappointed with food price or quality and quantity and if you aren't in the SW they now have a 2nd location in the SE area as well. So go!  What are you waiting for? You must go try them now.....go!!! ;0)

dT3sV8Hm6NzFmP0ELIdEYQ.text: This is my favorite pho place. The broth is always on point and rich in flavor. You know that it's good pho when you don't have to add in a lot of housin and sriricha and lime. I came in around 9pm and ordered shrimp spring rolls and chicken curry noodle soup. 5 minutes later I already got my order.   The shrimp spring rolls were huge! The peanut sauce is amazing here. 5/5 for these.   Chicken curry noodle soup: omg if anyone likes curry this is the thing to get. The flavor is so rich and delicious i scarfed down the whole bowl. I highly recommend getting this. 5/5!   Garlic chicken wings: they were pretty good. I did burn my tongue because of how hot they were. Lol. But that's a good thing how fresh they were :) I feel like they could've put a little sauce or something in it and maybe a little more garlic, but I love garlic so maybe that's why. I would say these get 3.5/5.   I'm also used to going to pho places and never getting checked up on. Our waiter came by a few times asking if we were okay. I'm so not used to that haha. So all In all if you're looking for some good pho with good service, swing by this place.

RZAJtBOR6bkpgIYytyi1wA.text: Here's the setup:  You're in vegas and wandered way off the strip to find a pho spot for some odd reason. You're hungover. You need sustenance, now.   You want to find Annie. You find annie in a small complex. You enter the store and voila, food....right? Wrong.  I don't know if it was just the day we went, but this place was severely understaffed. And by severely understaffed, I mean one waiter taking care of the entire restaurant with 3 or 4 people in the back cooking/handling to go orders...which leads me to the following points:  1) After being seated, we waited about 30 minutes to order. 2) After ordering, we waited another 30 minutes to get our food 3) Chicken curry pho is interesting, tasty, and new. $9 4) Pretty expensive pho for a small bowl 5) After devouring the pho, we waited 15 minutes for the check.  To the waiter's credit, he was friendly and calm given the circumstances. However, with the long trek from the strip, the pricey pho as compared to vegas Chinatown, and the super long waits, I'd pass.

ILDmuWTikUkOHkvnzXVxiw.text: This is probably the worst pho restaurant I have ever tried. The restaurant and the decorations are very nice but the staff are extremely rude and ungrateful. The pork was not tender, flavorless, and covered in oil. It came with sunny side up eggs and believe it or not, this was the best part of my meal even though I found lots of egg shells. When I told the employee about the egg shells, his response was, "its small." Instead of being apologetic, he was very defensive. I found lots of tiny eggs shells. Our server also managed to serve me the soup that came with the entree. I even asked what the soup was prior to ordering. With that said, my soup came way after my entree has been served. I do not recommend this restaurant at all. I will not be going back.

XPtWHwEn1hCIbuZK6vQH_A.text: Not a bad option for those pho cravings that we all get from time to time. One of the better bowls I've had since moving here to Vegas. They made sure our waters were consistently filled up. We came in a large group and they offered to ring us up separately at the cashier instead of having us trying to figure out how to split a check 9 ways. I love it when places offer to do this. Brownie points for them!  I had a standard Pho Tai (rare sliced beef) and wasn't disappointed. The broth was good and noodles were passable in my book. The rice dishes and vermicelli options also looked promising for my next visit.

I consider myself a pho noob so I'm not sure what constitutes the perfect pho so if I'll just summarize it by saying this is some damn good pho! QgFmVVQxTxemvZe9O_vvPQ.text: My recent experience here has inspired me to finally (after years of using yelp) start writing reviews!   Don't get me wrong the food is pretty good and cheap! But the service I received was HORRIBLE! I always get takeout and there was no problem but me and my friend stopped by to eat lunch and were in awe by this experience.  We got our food quick and it was good as always but we quickly got full and had pretty full plates. We asked for to go boxes and I kid you not we waited 20 minutes for the boxes! We're they busy? Not really. Did they apologize? NOPE. As soon as we got the boxes we asked for the bill... Guess what? We waited another 10 mins! We really complimented on just leaving cash and leaving.. I even said it out loud.. When he handed us the bill we quickly put in the card and handed it to him before he left!   They only got 2 stars because of the food, none for the service. Their attitude is horrible and even worse their customer service! I'm so glad they're opening a pho place closer to my house than this!

p8on4kaysgJz7UdC_Kk-zQ.text: When the craving for pho hits and I am stuck at home, this is my go-to since it is in the Southwest. My first time here was during lunch on a Monday. The place was COMPLETELY PACKED. Every booth and table was taken which was very surprising, but in the end, our food came out promptly and service was the usual for an Asian restaurant (I'm Chinese so I'm allowed to say that).   We ordered 2 bowls of the house specialty pho and the pan fried seafood noodles. Everything was SO good. The noodles were fried into a bowl shape and had a lot of shrimp, squid, fish, and an abundance of veggies (which I love). When you smash the fried noodles & stir it up with the seafood sauce, they turn into half crunchy/half tender noodles. The consistency was so good that I barely got a couple of bites in before my kids gobbled it all up. The pho was pretty good with the meat all very tender and not chewy (like when you just chew so much and force yourself to swallow because it's not falling apart enough, no, that never happened). The broth was good, although I tend to just take a preliminary taste before I dress it up with japalenos, lime, sriricha, and hoisen sauce.   The second time we went back was on Mother's Day at about 6PM. There were only 3 other tables there? I was wondering if I had missed something & if this place was closed down by the health district or something prior to our visit. Hopefully not. This time around, we ordered boba milk tea (75% ice, stop being so stingy), and the same order as last time + spring rolls. The spring rolls are standard, but served with extra lettuce to wrap around the spring rolls. Sure, I'm down to eat extra lettuce whenever I can, although others may not like it. The pho was the same as last time, but the seafood noodles were different. They had beef in them and bbq pork. It was lacking most of the seafood in the "crispy pan fried seafood noodles", and just tasted way different. I'm going to go again and order all the same stuff and decide if I should keep this spot on my radar. I wish the food was more consistent, but for now, I'll say it's alright.

xwodmErczV4JH_DKoK2ZQA.text: While in town getting ready for the Spartan race, we needed to get some carbs the night before. Usually it's spaghetti, but that night we decided to grab some Pho. A quick look at the yelp app and Pho Annie was a short drive away from the strip. It sits at in this little plaza with a couple of other restaurants and plenty of parking.  When you walk inside, you may or may not be greeted by anyone, so you just sit down wherever you like. There was one guy waiting all the tables, but he seemed to be pretty efficient at handling everyone. He brought us our drinks and  then shuttled off to another table. Then came back a few minutes later for our main order. The menu is pretty typical of what you'd find at any Pho restaurant. I didn't see Pho combination bowls that had everything like tendon, rib, tripe, meatballs, brisket and the like. It was more like getting one or the other. We ordered a set of crispy summer rolls with shrimp and they came out all hot and steamy fresh out of the fryer. The time intervals between ordering seemed to be decent. After the rolls were gone, out came the Pho and they regularly made sure that your cup was filled with drink.  When the Pho came out, the meat was still pink as they put it in at the last minute, the tendon was just right and the broth had that cinnemony anissy taste  that wasn't bad. They provided bean sprouts, lime and fresh basil. With a dollop of hoisin, a drop of chilli past (I opted this instead of the sriracha this time). It was pretty good.   So the service was efficient and the food did not disappoint. I'd stop here again.

FAuOaXV6wnQ4XwyBnVNgUA.text: New owners...used to be called Rainbow Pho.  The good thing about this Vietnamese Cuisine spot is that its close to the crib, otherwise, Pho87 is still hands down the best Pho joint in town.    What is nice about this place is that virtually nothing has changed but the name.  They have a diverse menu offering anything from Mango Salad (papaya salad with shredded green mango) to salt and pepper saba.    The pho selection is like any other except they offer some unique variations that I have not yet tried and can't recall the name...sorry, I know that isn't very helpful.  Otherwise, broth is ok...i'm not a critical broth nazi, but know good broth when I taste it.  But if I am feeling the urge, I can do with lower grade pho.    They have a descent crab noodle soup that I remember tasting when they were formerly Rainbow Pho...its was pretty good and tasted like bun bo hue.  Still, there are not many Vietnamese eateries in the deep Southwest of Las Vegas, so if you are hungry and don't want to drive to Chinatown, this place is worth a shot.  There is also Jenny Pho and Bamboo Bistro nearby.  The bubble tea is available in various flavors, I am not particularly fond of balls in my mouth, but I do recommend the three bean dessert drink...closest thing to halo halo.  They do have a drive through outside that I wish they implemented...but not sure if that will be a good or bad thing.

tVR7AlTm4ODIvEUQa8Eijg.text: A favorite for us! Ask fir the Satay!! Spicy, rare steak, noodle soup to die for! And Annie is rad!

iKVHL8YbPNW3vvJodRBJxQ.text: Looking for a cheap fill me up meal, get soup and noodles for a low 6.25! That's right boys and girls! Friendly service and quick.

MJJInJP8Cj9O3bRsspKt3w.text: Formerly Pho Annie - don't get it twisted. This is our go-to spot for pho. The new ownership brought such better customer service - hallelujah! They always remember us when we walk through the door and seem to genuinely be appreciative of our business.  Food is always that piping hot fresh - yuuuus! I'm always surprised at just how quick they are able to bring our food out. Keeps us coming back. The vermicelli with grilled pork and egg rolls is one of my favorites cause you get so much variety and flavor in 1 dish. If I'm doing Pho, Rare Steak Spicy Sate Noodle Peanut Thick Soup is my jam! The menu can be a bit overwhelming because there are so many options. If it's your first time, the pictures on the menu are gonna be your best friend. Happy eating :)

6-8rWg0Gd28CafSLe6EO2g.text: Stopped by here for takeout Pho while I was sick. It was really good and I will definitely be back. I may even eat in the restaurant next time!

PkIMP9p9XxHd2rhUM-q8WA.text: I've been here twice in the past few days why?  Cuz someone... mainly me... was sick and wanted something brothy....  So the first time I dined in and the second time I got it to go.  I got their spring rolls cuz well I LOVE me some spring rolls. And they were pretty good. The skin was a little on the chewy side the first time but I would prefer it chewy vs mushy. :)  For the pho.... I got the vegetarian one once and the rare beef the second time.  They were both very very good. The broth was good. I still think that pho so 1 has the best broth but Annie's comes pretty close especially seeing as how they are far from the Chinatown area.  So since Pho Annie is only 7 minutes away vs the 25 minutes to Chinatown.... Annie's it is!!!  :)  Overall... It's good!!! I will definitely be back!!! I'm looking forward to trying their vermicelli dishes next.... I'm just waiting for the weather to earn up a little.... When it is cold outside...I want my hot pho!!!! When my tummy is upset.... I want my Annie Pho!!!! :)

Cv7P_hyZ1prQjP7igcwy3A.text: This is my favorite pho restaurant in the entire city. I love how they always remember my order and that I end up with desert when I'm finished. Great atmosphere. Great service. Everything is tasty. Keep it up

4qUEZA0Jk--N9uUDwJDSWg.text: Went to this place because I was craving for some pho after going for weeks without Vietnamese food (crazy right???).   I ended up ordering pho chin (well done beef slices) which was actually pretty good compared to the restaurants on Eastern and some places in Chinatown. The broth had a good amount of flavor and reminded me of the taste I thought I could only get at the Vietnamese restaurants back home. I usually don't get full after eating a bowl of pho, but this place gives a good amount to keep you satisfied for a while. I also got their spring rolls which were good, but I don't think it is worth the price. I paid about $5-6 for 4 pieces which looked like 2 pieces that were just cut in half lol. I also ordered the fried rice which was alright. It was nothing special and I probably won't order that again if I do come back.   The restaurant is relatively clean which is good because Asian places are known to not be as clean as they should be. The staff was nice which is a plus in my book. I'd recommend going here over places like Pho So 1, Pho Kim Long, or Lemongrass if you are craving for some authentic tasting pho. I would go more often if it was closer to me!

RL-QbdFZZ9CXISFX-2FJBQ.text: "Soul pho real"  You are on my mind.  You are on my mind.  Every little thing I do you're on my mind.  (Nah, not really...it's not that serious lol)    My love, do you ever dream of curry coated chicken?  I came in feeling pretty sick. What is better than soup to the rescue? Oh, and a perfectly executed plan to get dessert off of Rainbow Blvd afterwards.   Items tried: 1) Spring rolls - Pretty standard flavor. Size wise a bit bigger than other places. Sauce is a little different, but still good.   2) Pho tai - Rare beef pho. I'm not a pho person, but I liked the broth! It's definitely up there in the top 3.  3) Chicken curry noodle soup - Wow. Believe the hype. I came all the way out here for this dish alone. Lahhhvvved it. Big pieces of whole chicken with big flavor. Lots of noodles and a warm, comforting broth. Guess what? I feel better. Soup cures!    Good food combined with fast, friendly service. I am happy to rate this place 5***** because it is well deserved.   Looking to try their fried chicken and bun thit nuong (grilled pork with vermicelli) next.

iMn-U8-9ee-mYuU9lnpTNQ.text: This place is a gem! Came here really hungover & their pho brought me back to life. The staff are so so kind, and the food is delicious. I normally put hoisen & sriracha in my pho, but their broth is so delicious I didn't need any!

E73DEMJgWWCSVyWp8TgDMw.text: I was in a hurry, but I still managed to pull off a meal here in just over half an hour.  My friends and I wanted to meet up for lunch, and they picked Pho Annie in spite of having just come from Southern California, which is one of the great centers of Vietnamese cuisine in this world. Another friend had previously told me to try it, so I agreed. It's a nice, traditionally decorated shop on a relatively remote stretch of Rainbow Blvd. It has comfy, clean seats and tables.  Due to tight scheduling, we didn't really share lunch. I had to head to work soon, and they were running into all kinds of traffic and construction. Oh well. I ordered early when the server kindly asked me whether I wanted to order food. I had the pho dac biet ($8.25), my standard order these days.  I definitely enjoyed the broth (better without lime, after experimenting), the noodles were fine, the lime and Thai basil were fresh and tasty, and most of the meats were great. I only had a bit of a faux pas with the "tai" meat, the one that's served raw and cooked in the broth). It was bland before it fully absorbed the broth's flavor. Also, the portion size seemed a little bit on the small side. I might have been especially hungry, which could have biased me a bit, but I generally like to have large bowls of pho.  Overall, it was a good meal that I wouldn't be against having again in the future. I won't go out of my way just for this, but it'll certainly be an option if I'm in the area.

eVXPkX9oDkHcAlzTbemGOw.text: Despite its convenient location this was my first visit to Pho Annie since it changed names and ownership.  I arrived around 6:30 with my friend and her daughter. We both ordered vermicelli bowls and some chicken wings for her daughter.   Food and service were sluggish, but we were engrossed in conversation so we didn't really notice. The meal itself was good, not great. Portions were generous but flavors weren't anything to write home about. We both left full and I'll likely order takeout here from time to time since it's convenient but I won't go out of my way.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork and eggroll vermicelli bowl

qvr6Yd_q8b941VQ3E0R8rQ.text: Most of the great reviews here are from when it was Pho Annie. Well, Annie is gone; she is up the road at Pho 88, serving up some of the best pho in town. The question is: is Pho Aimie worth keeping on the pho rotation?  Sadly, the answer is no. Without Annie, the quality here has gone sharply downhill. The pho is bland, the tendon undercooked, the meat mediocre. The chicken pho is downright bad: dry, overcooked chicken in beef broth. The beef stew is... okay, I guess, but pretty much everyone else in the area does it better. There just isn't anything to come here for.  With Pho 88 and Jenni Pho so close, and WTPho and Pho Saigon 8 not much further, why come here? No reason at all. I kept coming perhaps longer than I should have, but it's time to let go.

eqS7EmRqT6czDREIhmT_NQ.text: Love this little place close to my house. I always order the duck and spring rolls. Both is amazing!

ji2idOthovUnnazJySQwrA.text: This would be a 2 Star review but I added the extra star because the staff was really sweet.   But the broth on the rare steak noodle soup was so oily, you could see the oil sitting on top of the broth and not only that oil over powered the flavor of the broth.   Then nothing really seemed fresh. The jalapenos looked like they were cut and sitting out for at least a day. They were shriveled and the seeds were a brownish color and same with the sprouts, they were a light brown and rubbery.   Unfortunately I won't be returning here. Wish the food was a little better because the staff was really polite.

ePZ--wDkQCi1ky4YLyE_Jw.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting for the weekend and needed to cure our Vegas hangovers, so my cousin recommended this place that was a few minutes from her house. The bun bo hue was on point for me.  Service was friendly and fast.  Overall, it cured our hangovers and filled us up satisfied.

PIH9AI1ek0JBdwWw9ZJuig.text: This is my second time here but I am loving it.  A bit different lay out as it is one long strip to seat its guests.  I like the modern look from the walls, that I can just almost see the food being prepared which is a plus.  Tables and booths are appealing and service is good.

2LrLA0tnO1NS_56RZHy4fA.text: A good Pho restaurant in Vegas?! Can it be??  Yess!!   It's about time that I write a review about this place. I live right down the street so you'll find me here for dinner if I'm too lazy to drive out or cook for myself. Their location is great for me, but for the masses they are at a huge disadvantage. They are located on the south side of town, 20 minutes or so away from Chinatown, which is where most people who seek out Vietnamese or any type of Asian food will go. They are also hidden in a complex where there storefront cannot be seen from the street.  When it comes to Vietnamese food, I am quite spoiled. I grew up on my grandma's homemade Pho, so most Pho restaurants in Vegas don't even compare. Pho Annie though...hits the spot! Satiates that craving.   When I order a bowl of Pho, I like it to be perfect without me having to add any of the condiments available. Hoisin and sriracha should be a dipping sauce for the meat not to flavor the diluted bowl of broth that some places try to serve. Of course everyone has their preferences but regardless the foundation of the dish has to have substance to begin with.   Their broth is perfectly balanced...very hearty and full of flavor (but not salty) unlike many other restaurants that will serve diluted broth or broth that tastes like MSG. The noodles aren't soggy or undercooked and the vegetables are fresh. Everything just comes together.   Service could be better, but Vietnamese restaurants are notorious for awkward service. The servers do not look you in the eye when they are talking to you or taking your order. They most likely won't be checking up on you. HOWEVER...you will get your food within 5-10 minutes...which is nice.   If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese food, seek Pho Annie!!

aQsDfptrT7ya-94c9BEG0g.text: Always fast and great service!..the guys up front are very hospitable and welcoming!..food is good and fair price.

hpW3HqttyqQP0WYgGteKiw.text: Really good pho! I had the chicken curry soup which is totally out of my comfort zone but it was delicious. jGDhr8nkuFpWEdOM74oWIA.text: Been here many times before.  A great Vietnamese resturant with a nice atmosphere, clean interior with modern decorations. They have booth style seating on one side of the restaurant and the kitchen is on the other side.  So there's nobody next to you watching you eat. Nice privacy to me.    This place is always busy when you arrive or get ready to leave but there's always a table open and service is fast.  Food is delivered right away.  They really care about the asthetics of their dishes making it that much more appealing.   We had pho, egg rolls, spring rolls, garlic chicken wings and pad Thai. And Thai tea. Everything was awesome!  You can't go wrong with any dishes! Place to be for lunch or dinner!

Gm3bdVCpu556e-cqGvfaKg.text: First time at this restaurant. We enjoyed everything. At first the server was a little abrupt because of my active and loud toddler. The service was fast, food tasty, and the server was friendly. Spring rolls, fresh coconut drink are awesome.

KOh6aCAJlE_L845ur3IJOw.text: Good food, flavorful, clean and the waitstaff was very nice and helpful. Good if you live in the southwest side of town and do not want to drive to china town to get Vietnamese food.

x4Gqus67Iu1pFd1w_wslpQ.text: Great Broth.... This place is very busy. And i can tell why. Glad uts close to home. Will eat here again. But i wish there was more seating

iX_nvptyB4HrLjtIIrE9hQ.text: Pros - One of few Vietnamese restaurants located in the Southwest. It's convenient for the area. - Pho is delicious. Few places get the broth right and they do a great job with their flavors.  - Fried chicken wings. Their chicken is so crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. Again, great with flavors.  Cons - The service is okay. A bit on the slow side and seem disorganized. - Not the best looking. There's duct tape holding their booths together and it's not entirely clean. - Questionable things. Their iced coffee (ca phe sua da) is pre-made, poured into a plastic cup unlike the traditional hot coffee, french drip, self poured over condensed milk and ice. I believe they do this to save on time, but it takes away from the experience and taste of the coffee.  Stars for good food, but I wasn't truly a fan of their service and appearance. This is really more of a 2 1/2 star rating from me.

5ywoBJot4fsYkC-bl0fX2Q.text: FINALLY! I have found a place where I can truly enjoy a nice bowl of pho! If you know anything about my pho searching journey in Vegas, you'd know that I've been pretty disappointed with every experience I've had at a Vietnamese restaurant thus far. But eureka! Pho Annie does it for me.   First off, we need to cover location because it is not an easy find. Complex is rather odd. It's almost like the complex curves toward the street with Pho Annie tucked on the inside hidden from the street view.  Just look for Chee Burger Chee Burger, it's in the same complex.  Restaurant isn't large 5-6 booths on the left, 3-4 tables on the right. First visit was during lunch and it got packed fast. Second visit was on a Sunday night and it was much slower. I order the Annie Special pho that includes all meat additions (tripe, fatty brisket, tendon, meat balls, flank). In Houston, we are given the option of small bowls or large bowls for pho and this would definitely be considered as the large bowl. The bowl costs around $7. I order the egg rolls as an appetizer and they're great -- comes with 4 large egg rolls. Keep in mind pho doesn't take long to prepare at all so your main course will most likely follow the app within 5-10 minutes.   It's really hard to describe the taste of the broth. All I can really say is that I truly enjoyed it. It had the perfect amount of flavor and I actually sipped on it after I ate up everything else.   And if pho isn't your thing, they have a wide selection of other dishes. Can't go too much in detail of that for ya cause I didn't pay close attention.. sorry!  My favorite pho place so far! The only downfall is you have to spend a minimum of $10 to use your credit card.

f3eo0gPWk5TiVNKZExu5WA.text: Happy to say I finally found my place for pho. I am new to Las Vegas so I had tried other places in the area and it just wasn't that great whether it was the service or the taste of the actual product.   I was very impressed by this place and will e back again often.

x42Hab8MnMvEkVdCqE26Cg.text: This place was alright service wasn't attentive nor can't even care to refill my coke gottah ask for it like the place is small can't missed anything it's not even busy or anything  but it's whatever.

n97ajh9u2pF5S7IUAvY63w.text: I'm not into Pho, but I pick some up for my wife when she asks and take it to her for her lunch. She really likes the Pho here.

rWOZo90m4Uz87mPMuI9SUw.text: This was my first time here.  The service was okay.   The food was awesome everything came up fresh the restaurant was really clean. I love the taste of the fish sauce I got some kind of noodle with veggies and egg rolls it was really good. I will come back here next time my boyfriend is not into this kind of food so I will have to come back with a friend I would love to try the Pho  and the Bunbue hue (however you spell it )

jA0OQC4OVvrzDhIyUrdhGQ.text: I have finally found a Fried Rice Dish that I love. Ate here back to back days and have not been disappointed, friendly staff and I can watch ESPN with the sound on. Price point is perfect, I could sit here all day.

nBGcEH42v2txIFxs1xbgjw.text: Impressive broth coupled with chilis in oil next to the Sriracha and Hoisin. Lots of attention to detail with this broth recipe. A modest amount of saltiness completely complemented by the robust beefy flavor and judicious spices make this Pho worthy of praise.  Very busy when I go in most times, and seating can be limited. A trendy, popular place for a good reason: good food!

jAI3VRh3rE0SFP768HWl_w.text: This is my third time here.  The last two were about a 4 - fast service, courteous, and attentive.  This last time was a 2 at best - but it was also a Saturday night after Christmas.  I thought it was fair to average the score.  When we arrived there was a wait - about 7 people were waiting in the doorway.  There was no one taking names.  As more people came in, I asked if anyone was going to start taking names so they know who was there first and he replies "oh ok - good idea."  About 15 minutes later we sat down.  I quickly ordered some appetizers as we were hungry.  Fried egg rolls, fresh spring rolls and pot stickers.  The spring rolls were pretty good but the egg rolls and pot stickers were just ok.  The appetizers came out real fast.  We got waters right away.  I then ordered our dinner.  We ordered two orders of pho (rare meat and rare meat and tripe) a grilled shrimp dish, salt and pepper squid and beef chow fun.  The shrimp came out first.  two skewers with 4 small pieces on it.  The shrimp wasn't bad, just small.  The meal came with soup which I believe is just the broth from their pho but for some reason, this broth was yummy and flavorful - and our two bowls of pho tasted as if they started to run out of broth and they added some hot water.  Very disappointing.  The squid was average.  It wasn't greasy and it was well cooked, however the squid itself was chewy.  The chow fun never came out even after I reminded them twice and after we were done with our meal I asked someone to cancel it.  About two minutes later, another server came by and said they were really busy in the kitchen and my noodles will be another 10 minutes.  sigh.  To be fair, the times before the pho was great. Rare steak was fresh and not chewy. Had the duck pho and that was really good. Lots of meat. Perfect seasoning.   Not sure if it was because they were busy, but be that the food quality and service went down drastically I hesitate about returning.

GivwIXwV0kG6YPrV_dBGXA.text: Not a fan. Just came here for dinner tonight and I don't think I'll be coming back. They were not busy when we were seated. I ordered the rare steak and beef strip pho and my boyfriend got potstickers.   Apparently our server was hard of hearing because I ended up with rare steak and tripe. Not worth pointing out their mistake. I was scared I'd have my food spit in. The only redeeming thing about the dish was it wasn't overly salty so they probably held back on the MSG, ha. The potstickers weren't tasty either. 6 oily pieces came to an order.   Price was on par with other pho places. But I still wouldn't recommend this place.

c6KYcL5Uy8Cz4pAiDaGyxA.text: Great little Thai restaurant live the shrimp spring rolls and the beef stew great service too fast and friendly live the atmosphere inside.

8X4-9B3Ih4LHvP-y4d241Q.text: I was having problem with the soup spoon; it was dirty. Therefore, I was hesitant about the cleanliness of the restaurant. My friend and I got the special, and for a small bowl, I think it was overpriced. There are other pho restaurant around the area that gives bigfer quantity for a cheaper price. The waiters were very nice and accomodating; they seated and got our orders fairly quick without any problems.

qVr68KRB5FDhGX-GP81gtA.text: The pho here is so good.  I wonder how I've never came across this place.  The pho broth here is on point.  Not to heavily salty and just the perfect amount of sweetness.  Service isn't the greatest but it's not terrible.

U0nTooSYFRriYhpKhYYGOw.text: My new favorite Pho spot in Vegas.  Pho around the valley usually has the same base broth taste, same egg rolls, which isn't a bad thing at all.  Pho Annie ticks off all the blocks on taste, price, and ambiance one would expect from a Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas.   Portions were definitely on the larger side as well.  1 thing however stood out, and that one thing is what will keep me coming back.  The service. AMAZING service. Great Customer service and very accommodating. Our party had 5 adults and one 14 month old girl. The food ordered came out on time. Our drinks were refilled throughout our meal, and any requests we had we met with pleasant service; which as a lot of us know, is not always a given when it comes to Asian dining :P  Vegas is a service industry city, and Pho Annie sets the bar high. I've been to almost all the Pho restaurants in the Vegas Valley since 1995, my main haunts used to be Pho Kim Long (Until they raised their prices) and then Pho Saigon (Until the broth got too sweet and it was just depressing eating there...).  You won't be disappointed. I promise you.

Lz3FAAYosRsw1Rxl4NCasA.text: Its a great Pho place and plus its near my home. Love this place.   The pho is here is to die for. and their butter fried chicken wings (OMG soooo good)!!!  There's couple of other pho places nearby, but Annie's is the one for me.

AW8Qi3XDnl3R6r9AD0ENpQ.text: Food is awesome especially the spring rolls and egg rolls! However the spring rolls are pre made so if you want them fresh order them without pork. The restaurant is really small so if you don't feel like waiting on this delicious food they always do take out even on pho!

13shMG0XJUJ9Iei1XL82Xg.text: I have to say this has been the far most best service I have had at any pho restaurant the people are nice and service is hecka quick! Food was amazing!!! Keep up the great work God bless!

N2l9M4lCM7UXsAwJwpuahQ.text: I just had the beef pad Thai.  Amazing!  It was sweet and savory with a great texture. I also liked the scrambled egg that came with it.   We had spring rolls that were good but a little over powered by the mint.   My wife had the chicken curry pho. We both enjoyed the flavor- spicy, but not too spicy.  Keep in mind that this dish has none in chicken.   Last thought, the AC works REALLY good in here so you may want to take a sweater.   This is definitely a good place to eat.

XH0vDBNUPqgBY6fXE-BA1Q.text: We went here for Pho last night as our regular haunt is closed on Sundays. Pros - Really good Chicken Pho & Vietnamese Egg Rolls. The sauce for those was a bit different from the regular sweet chili sauce we are use to, but it was pleasantly delicious.   Cons - very small restaurant with the capacity of 49 people (I guess that would be if every table had 4 per seating. Sunday night every table was full at 745pm and there were two other families trying to be seated (one of 3 and one of 4). This made for slow response from the waiter to come and take our To-Go order. It wasn't too terrible a wait but it did take 10 minutes for them to come over and ask what we needed.  The Parking lot is huge, as it is sitting next to the Lodge on Shelburne. So there is plenty of parking. They do take credit cards and cash. The staff is pleasant (those we spoke with). Our Order was ready in 15 minutes.  We will definitely be going back so we can try other options on their menu.

oRjItFHTe218Xh7C4yOcuA.text: WE LOVE THIS PLACE! Former Rainbow Pho Express Annie took her dream and what Rainbow was not.... and its a brilliant outcome!  Pulling up in the parking lot you notice that the Drive Through has been blocked. That was her first smart move!  Upon entering hubby and I were greeted and taken to one of the many comfortable booths.  We were given Rainbow Pho menus and they are bright colored and a little confusing. Hubby asked for somthing on the menu and she said "ewwww that's not good we are taking that off the menu". We chuckled and started asking was is really good and so hubby just asked for his usual Vietnamese love.....Pho Ga Chicken :)  I skimmed down the menu and hubby spoke up and said "beef chow fun" yummmmmm yes I will take it!  We were asked if we would like to start with Spring Rolls or an app. I said soft spring rolls and with no Shrimp. She offered Tofu and our order was on the way back to the kitchen :)  We both ordered just water to drink but yummy looking bean drinks and coconut water etc kept coming out. Grrrr we will have to go back :)  I noticed immediately that the items on the table were individually wrapped chopsticks, two big bottles one with hosin and the other with sriracha. Two small glass dishes with spoons, one held bonito type fish flakes in a dark fish oil, the other one held very spicy yummy red chili sauce. Yummmmmm my kinda condiments.    Our spring rolls came out and two side plates and two bowls of yummy peanut sauce. The sauce was not too thick and not too thin. The peanut flavor was there but not over powering. The soft spring rolls were filled with green leaf lettuce, chrispy tofu, yummy thin rice noodles, and some mixed veggies...the standout was the hidden Thai basil in them.  At this point we knew we would be cray cray about this place and it's dangerously close to our house :D  Hubby's Pho came out and I noticed that the broth immediately filled the room.....I was thinking "I must try that" so we both dug in and found slow cooked tender chicken and tons of thin rice noodles. The Pho was PERFECT. After ooooing and aaaaaaing. My dish came out.  My beef Chow Fun was perfect. The taste of wok/boarder line grill and the perfect amount of green onion, beef and yummy flat noodles. This dish actually blew away the Chow Fun that I eat at my fav San Fran Chinatown spot........now that is hard to do.  The price was about $27.50 and I had leftovers to snack on later (I stay up very late) or for lunch the next day. About $6 for the rolls, I think there were six. About $9.99 for the chicken Pho and $7.99 for the chow fun.  Big portions, we both could only eat half the rolls and maybe half the chow fun. Hubby def did good on the Pho and he said that out of any he has had in the world.....it was the best.  As a matter of fact........ The next night hubby asked to go there again LOL!!!! :D  For a picky eater like him......that is really saying something :D  TOTES YUM!!!!!! GO GET SOME!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I asked Annie to do vegetable chow fun...yummmmmm soo good :D
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. yummmmy vegetarian Pho
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Annie Pho combo and behind tofu soft spring rolls

eU7rpQpH2RQ99-Fw25sT7w.text: The soup of the pho has tons of msg.  The fried chicken wings was very good. It is a local spot as it is far far away from the strip.   The curry chicken rice is solid.   The curry sauce is not very spicy with lots of chicken.

sJnK3OLVMYPQ08LxfFeG9g.text: Service is great and the food is even better! I recommend The Pho sushi or Pho chicken.

I3CDnc0vM10HpeneyQsTRw.text: I've been to about four different pho restaurants in Las Vegas. So far this is my favorite. It taste amazing and I like the staff they are super friendly.

DE7Yy6Vg4D_0zD3DF3upJg.text: My favorite Vietnamese place in Vegas!! Been coming here over 5 years now and always great service!!! And yet SO good.. love the spring rolls!!!!

0N6r_MwgIuR1HRBLBvbDyg.text: Was on a different side of town than my normal Pho place and so glad I decided on this place!!!  Huge bowls, best tasting broth I've ever had.  I will make the 20 minute drive back to this place from now on for my pho fix!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plain noodle pho for her &amp; steak for me!

kLRlOTgEWrM62bFTmP97VA.text: I have pho a handful of times a year so I'm no expert but I've been to this location a ton of times and everything has been great. This trip I had the rare steak pho and my kid had the shrimp pho. I would have preferred a few more leaves, jalapenos and limes but I didn't ask. In visits past I've ordered shrimp fried rice and the garlic butter chicken wings without complaint. Service is always consistent here, they aren't pushy and there's usually one guy who's either a manager or owner who is very thankful and appreciative of our business. One trip I ordered food to go and the same guy offered candy to my kid (not in a creepy way).

MPNBaRHAWDR5pZrXBegG-A.text: It was my first time here, the people were nice. However, the food didn't taste good and the place was small with a smell. The decorations were dull looking, it just wasn't worth it, I'd rather order at Saigon 8.

jSpPVMtjB2rg1EY2kaJS-g.text: Great big bowl with very good broth, nice comfortable setting we really like this place and great prices we'll be back soon

MkdEO0GYoKpatektupndwg.text: Very good vegetarian broth pho! Also accommodate custom orders. I usually get extra carrots instead of their mushrooms. 4 stars because the mushrooms taste like canned.

BxgfXHG-d92kQuFlY1Sb0w.text: We Love Love Love Pho Aimie!!! Awesome customer service and very good tasting food!!! We come here at least once a week and it's consistently the same. Fast and friendly service!

hbC0ULcLYNYUFb7r7bRArQ.text: Definitely will come back again! We were looking for a new pho restaurant. I am not a huge fan of pho because of the some broths tasting  too gamey for me, so I was looking for a pho restaurant that served more than pho. Thanks Yelpers! My husband had the beef brisket in chicken broth. I tried it and it was delicious and no gamey taste. I had the kalbi ribs with rice and it came with eggs over easy. Tender and just the right amount of sweetness on the ribs. The fried rice with Chinese sausage was good also! They give huge portions. We brought half of our dishes home. Staff was attentive. We would come back again and have pho in this 107 degree weather!

e8g0ZYkbTC5Symw_Bn0xgA.text: It was a busy night when we tried out Pho Aimie (right down the street from my parents' house). Ample parking and even a drive-through option. We were seated quickly. Service overall was good. Courses came out as they were ready so my poor mother had to wait another 10 minutes for her meal while we were all rudely slurping away on our pho. The pho was large portions but the soup was on the light side and not as a flavorful as I expected. I see the reviews for bad service, but ours was fine and they even apologized for how busy it was and how it may have affected their presence at our table. I think food-wise there are probably more outstanding options but Pho Aimie is not a bad choice for those who live in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bxrk7ybkFBhNe2O6VlRZ_w.text: We stopped by today for lunch before our flights.  Seems like this place keeps changing names I think this is the third name in a few years.  The restaurant is nice and quiet and service was decent.  Everything was going great until we decided to open the packaging for their chopsticks.  This was the nastiest thing I've seen in awhile lol.  We literally opened ten chopsticks and EVERY single one of them had this weird black mold growing on it.   that was the look on all our faces.  We even tried grabbing from the surrounding tables.    When the waiter walked by he looked at it and said oh yea... I guess I'll go get you guys regular chopsticks and he never came back.  My wife had to get her own fork from their utensil table.  So yes. We had to eat pho with forks. Lol.  We wanted to leave but the food had already been served and the waiter disappeared after the chopstick incident until it was time for the check.  If you're gonna go check them out just bring your own utensils lol or go somewhere else. That would be the better option.

hl9-dBBXdIa3rB0WPaL1Ug.text: I've heard lots of praise for Pho Annie, and popped in to catch up with a friend over lunch. Location is nicely decorated and staff were really attentive during our visit. Unfortunately, food was pretty hit or miss for us.  Dishes weren't coursed, and Neli got her #16 Pho pretty quick, only to be followed by our fresh shrimp spring rolls (which were the best item we tried). Several minutes later, my Yellow Noodle Duck Soup (a featured special) arrived at the table. Both soups were hot, and I really liked the broth, but neither of us finished our meats- the duck was a generous portion but not particularly flavorful and somewhat tough and dry. There was a huge amount of noodles, though, making the portion even larger than expected.   Total bill for two was around $30, not bad pricing. I'd consider coming back for the rolls and maybe a rice bowl or another appetizer, but the soups just didn't live up to the hype for us.

cgvTviFKDBwFf5EyEshmwA.text: Delicious delicious!!! I came here the other day because I was craving curry and Vietnamese food- I yelped and out popped pho Annie, a place where I can get chicken curry with pho noodles and it was fantastic!!! My boyfriend went with me and he got the beef stew and that was yummy as well!  The broths for both our meals were full of flavor and depth- reminds me of my parents home cooking! The only thing about the chicken curry is I would probably put a tiny bit more broth to it because it was kind of thick. Other than that, amazing!  The staff were nice and the place was nice and clean!!! All in all, I will be back again for more and prices were fair too! I think my chicken curry was $8.99 for a large bowl and they were very generous with the chicken! Stephan's beef stew had tender pieces of beef that was cooked to perfection as well and was plentiful!!!

Gsr-yZNEjIhNzPuRO32llw.text: Service was very good here.  The place was clean when we came by.   Pho here is ok, it's missing anise and some other ingredients that makes you crave for pho.  The spring rolls we ordered were big, but then only packed with noodles.

ngSe0VPdE0o9Cjm4SLYmCQ.text: Super great service here! The pho was delicious! We also got to try the vermicelli with chicken and that was really yummy as well. we were even able to get a small bowl of just the broth for our son! I'm looking forward to returning!

8Z1exbtpZgB9VJai-VLeKA.text: I called to place a simple order. The place used to be called pho annie. New menu, new order #s, I getit. It was for beef and rice  and soup. I explained this 3 times. The woman who answered the phone was not only rude, but hung up on me. It was such a simple order. I would like to see them closed. Wife and I have been eating there for years. Nope, now they will learn what happens when you blow off your long term customers. Bitch.

FI3sSIHPD9qOKdovrvMpwg.text: This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in town. Their foods are tasty and prices are reasonable. I tried multiple dishes on their menu and my favorites are Satay beef noodle soup, pho special, Korean ribs with rice, and bun rieu. Must try restaurant !! Great service

_2ec0Hkq1slg1gNWnV15Fg.text: Very good pho and very nice service.   Dropped in to grab an order of pho and spring rolls to go. The pho order was large, nicely packaged and had a great flavor. The nice man on phone stated it would take 15 minutes for the order but I arrived early, ready to wait, but the food was ready to go.   The spring rolls were good, though I did wish it had more ingredients like carrots in the mix but it was still good.   I also ordered beef stew for lunch the next day and it too was very good. Filled with tons of beef and deliciously stewed carrots.  Definitely a good pho place on this side of town. I'd go back any day.

qWRNnBVe8weYUoJL_nXjAA.text: First time came here, it's DELICIOUS! I came here with my cousin who invited me to try this restaurant. So far, I tried:  - #40 Grilled Pork Chop, over egg with broken rice & soup - Shrimp Spring Roll  It's Mmmm... delicious, fast, and fresh food. After eating the first bite of the grilled pork chop, it was delicious and had lots of flavor even without the fish sauce.  I recommend coming here because the quality of the food is great. The restaurant and the atmosphere is clean. The staff here are nice, responsive, and quick. I might as well say this, this Vietnamese restaurant is the BEST than other Vietnamese restaurants I went to in Las Vegas. The food portion is huge and will make your stomach happy and satisfied.
