xDh8NVnWcppOkk6oArX74A.text: What the pho, Annie? Don't expect a server to welcome you kindly or promptly get your order here. We were able to complete our meal during lunch hour and for that I am grateful.   Ordered the egg rolls, however they came after the rest of our meal. This appetizer comes with a ton of greens. They did not come with a dipping sauce so I just started trying all the ones on the table to figure out which one went with it, without success. I don't usually eat this kind of food so excuse my ignorance.   For lunch I had the chicken curry soup. It's a thicker soup that comes out piping hot so hold your horses. It was just a little spicy. Chicken wings with skin fill the bottom of the bowl. I had to get back to work and did not want to dirty my hands so I picked the best I could with my utensils. I think next time I'll try the spring rolls and a clearer broth next lunch.

bJASidZJdooscCaaDN4wgQ.text: Great pho spot in southwest vegas!  Broth is flavorful and consistent.  I've been here about a dozen times in the last 2 years and have never been disappointed.

02OFt5zw05mzamCXNjNlpQ.text: They accept cards not like the other pho place down the road. Their pho is pretty good. I like the spring rolls and the grilled prawn and rice. Server made sure we never ran out of water. This is now our neighborhood pho place.

yHeW3mmWqUvKt59oNwmHDQ.text: Ahh, Pho! Absolutely hits the spot! Depending on what time you go, there may be a wait, but that speaks volumes for the quality in this very small venue. Worth it.

_p28UG1LZ6ytXAQSYzp-mg.text: This place is good! They are pretty friendly and service is quick. When you walk in, you don't immediately get the overpowering pho smell as with most other pho restaurants. Their pho bowls are not bad. I would travel further into china town for a better bowl but this place is closer and more convenient. Decent portions of meat to noodle so no complaints there. My family orders take out from her quite often. It's enough to split into two good sized meals.

5QLMu6DpLkPwiKz2xpPQKQ.text: Finally a decent pho restaurant near the house without driving all the way to chinatown. The food here is actually not too shabby, but the service is typical of any asian restaurants LOLZ, doesn't bother me one bit. The service has gotten alot better over the past year now that they have more staff, so they are getting better.        The location is perfect for those of us that live down south. Infact It's so close to the house, that I could even walk there haha. I would have to say the food is above average so I can't really complain, I've tasted worst in chinatown. The price is actually pretty good in comparison to other pho restaurant that's why we come here frequently. Been here probably 20 times by now and tried pretty much EVERYTHING! Like I said, overall food is DECENT, service is OK but location is PERFECT.

kaBz93RhhLnbHOCyUpHPKQ.text: Nice cozy atmosphere. Staff is nice and polite. Food is great and you don't have to wait long for it!

3jhU9Zn45q22NtLF1aIOXw.text: The bf and I come here often for the pho soup, which is really good. I wasn't feeling like soup today, so i tried the pad thai with tofu. It was pretty tasty. Not the best I've ever had, but then again, it's a pho place. It had sort of a smokey flavor that I wasn't crazy about, but I put some soy sauce on it and It was fine. Forgot to ask for it without peanuts (allergy) and it came out drenched in peanuts. Most places just sprinkle a little on the top. I apologized profusely and asked of I could have it without nuts. Appetizer, I had tofu spring rolls, which are always really good. Bf had combination pho soup and egg rolls, both of which he liked. Service is always great.

xAK7AHH4kPLM3mtzgT9bFQ.text: Great lunch place.  Rare beef pho broth was nice and fragrant.  Very cheap too compared to some other places I've been.

HNbg4WX2gGrTjqqfOiRcnw.text: Food was mediocre. I tried their signature pho and egg roll and found out to be bland compared to others around town. Service is with an attitude. You must flag them down for water or other requests. You feel that you are bothering them.  Worst part of my experience was finding they charged me a higher price than what is listed on the menu. When you confront them, there is no apology whatsoever. Do not eat here, owners are dishonest.

FzvOGdmaF-gKv6Ifx2tphQ.text: I love anni pho ! I come here all the time.  Comparison to other pho places, anni pho's soup is very clear which means its less fat. Service is great too.

CLMsVi5jeXvXmcoxPkUF7g.text: I used to eat at Jenni pho but since I found this restaurant, I have eaten here every week. There are not a lot of Vietnamese restaurants on Rainbow and on this side of town, but this restaurant is stand out. Their Bun Bo Hue is the best in town in my opinion. Very authentic!!! All of the rice dishes are great. Pho is much better than Jenni pho. Wonton soup is great. Hu tieu Bo kho is decent. Alot of noodle though. The service is fast. I only gave 4 stars because the hu tieu satay was not good.

o-RfHWOF_AK9gG8AZf64uw.text: Great service... I will definitely recommend this place to others. Good food and portions.

yE9JyNVhE0DjQPIQvvIIxw.text: No longer will I need to travel all the way to china town for good pho.  This place has everything that you would expect from an Asian restaurant.  Great food, oriental atmosphere, servers that barely speak English and mediocre service...lol.  To compare the food i'd have to say its a little better than Pho Kim Long, except for the calamari.  I don't know what Pho Kim Long does to their calamari but theirs just can't be beat.   Annie's Pho however is extraordinary; always on point.  Most pho for me is a hit or miss on the broth (e.g. jennie pho) but Annie has never disappointed.  I like the fact that they include the soup with all their rice dishes as well.  So I never have to order a big bowl of pho if i just want the soup.  Very convenient for me.  The main difference with Annie is that its just once size bowl.  So you have no choice but to have a big bowl of pho everytime.  Oh and they have duck... i love duck.  It's not on the menu but for those in the know, know.  The have pho with duck as well.  Nothing fancy here, just a quarter duck served in pho, but i still like.  Their portions are bigger than Pho Kim Longs as well.  Their Charbroiled Pork Chop with egg comes with 2-3 pieces of pork chop and 2 eggs compared to Pho Kim Longs 1-1 1/2 pieces and one egg.  Oh and its cheaper too.  Spring rolls are pretty much the same as everywhere else.  The Mango Shrimp Salad is a must have every time I go there.  Sweet with a little sour and just oh so good.  Annie is usually there, i take that back, Annie is always there making sure everyone is being taken care of.  I always like to see this in a small business owner.  She puts in the work.    Some of the other employees...eh...not sure if they are all their sometimes.  This one server, my gf spoke to him in Vietnamese and in English and he still didn't understand.  We had to point and use hand signals... really weird.  He was good at keeping my water filled though.  I know we've all experienced the server not understanding you in these kind of restaurants so I can't really explain.  Its part of the experience I guess.  Food takes a while sometimes but everything is made fresh and they come out sporadically.  No waiting till every ones food is ready.  You just gotta be ready to eat when it comes.  All in all I have a 4 star experience at Pho Annies on the average.  If it wasn't for the  delay in receiving the food and the random slow acting server i would have given it a 5.

HJ__8G361B2MDSPNuyS21Q.text: Best place to get pho near my house. I usually get the rare steak pho. If you don't feel like pho you should definitely try the pork chop with fried egg, and broken rice.

uqT4hzNGwEcjV5SdY4bAiQ.text: I didn't know this place changed owners, but I'm a fan. I liked the previous place, but like this one even more. The broth was so flavorful. Deep, rich, and aromatic broth with a good punt of noodles and meat. Hands down my go to pho spot in the southwest!!!

ZXS9Yea0L7xaMjkWsIcVcg.text: This place use to be called rainbow pho until one of the servers purchased the entire restaurant.  Pho Annie is a great place to grab pho or if your into the meat dishes like the grilled pork chops.  This is located on the west side for all you west side peepz!  My friend and I ordered the Chicken Pho and I ordered the grilled lamb chops with rice and egg. And for appetizers we had the fresh Vietnamese wraps.  Our food was amazing, service was great, greeted with a smile and acknowledge you as a returning customer.  cannot complain much about this place.

tZT34pVwzt8hUlC5cU4PyA.text: So Michael Jackson was a thief who stole his music.  One of his greatest hits actually originated in Vietnam... notice the similarities below??  Hmmm????  Pho Annie Are You OK So, Annie Are You OK Are You OK, Pho Annie  Well that was weird....  Anyway, this restaurant is more than just okay, it's one of my favorites.  The dishes here are really big.  The all star is the pork chop, w broken rice and egg.  Add egg rolls if you want to get really cray cray.  Be warned, this dish is BIG.  I wonder if the broken rice is bought broken or they break it in the restaurant, message me if you think you have the answer, I am curious.  Restaurant has the sweetest staff.  Ingredients fresh.  Portions big.  Prices fair.  What else do you want?  This place is a winner in my book, so glad it's by my work.

bXpziCalaQG6Jg1bCHX8pA.text: very friendly friendly and attentive staff considering how busy they were. Good food, reasonable price, good pho.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IYpxgC-k9N2p3dNIRo2ifA.text: I walked in and I found myself awkwardly standing in front of a family trying to enjoy their meal. Although the place is not very large, it can accommodate small parties quite comfortably. I can never find myself to stray from my usual bowl of Pho and that is exactly what I ordered. I usually frequent Pho So 1 but this place seemed like it deserved a try and I'm glad I did. I will probably choose this place for my Pho fix if I am coming from home. For ~$8 (average price), I had a good sized helping of noodles and meat. The broth itself was slightly oily for my taste and there appeared to be no MSG. I enjoy Pho both with and without MSG, but I do prefer without because of the cotton mouth feeling I get after eating MSG.   So the verdict? Long wait to be seated, long wait to order, long wait to receive the check but my patience probably needs practice anyway. I'll be back, pho-sho.

09pcFE9Zo32hqFJkJwbFng.text: It's long way for me to get there, but I will give it a shot to see how good is it,the restaurant is very nice in and out,clean and neat,the services is good,the food is not worth the trip sorry.

gUX_dVGDHut-gY02Oylc6A.text: This place is not on our way home.. but it was worth having the pho for late lunch. It's still one of our favorite place to go to for a good pho. New renovation update. Friendly staff. Good services and great food and pricing. Can't beat that!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. RareBeef Pho; Broth is so good!

CeRr6guI5a0Yyrx6tsnuQw.text: Have you tried their beef stew? Hmmm hmm hmmm hmm hmm.  The beef stew noodle soup was so good that I probably won't ever get anything else. I love beef stew and since they threw some noodles in with the beef stew it made it like no other beef stew I've ever had. Was it the best beef stew I've had? No but it was different and very enjoyable that I wanted more. Technically its pho, it was under the pho section on the menu but I wouldn't call it your typical pho it was thicker, I dont think Ive seen any other pho place serve it, and I won't add those usual pho ingredients and hot sauces. Those in the group who ordered the pho seemed like they enjoyed it but I already know what I'll get here.  They make other non-pho items like various pad thai and various Asian dishes which looks good from the pictures. The prices are reasonable and a decent place 3.5 star. It does feel and look like a dirty place. I'm a little curious how the health place feels about Annie Pho but if I didn't get sick I'm OK with going here again. There's not a lot of pho places in the area so I'll throw them in my rotation being all cold outside right now.

JH0DvIkeuRxrdXqh2KsiEA.text: Our go-to spot for Pho. We eat here once or twice week! Service is good, food is spot on, and we drive past other Pho places just to come to this one.

n4swGABe-EShs0Jx9fqe5Q.text: Big portions. Great staff that really wants to take care of you, and quality food. I only wish they took the Thit Nuong off the bone prior to it making to the table. Everything else was top notch.

Blms6-r4zhLckEZ0PjdIfA.text: Awesome customer service and even better food! I've been here about 10+ times and I've never had an issue with the food or staff.   Not the biggest or best looking restaurant but one of the best pho restaurants in Vegas!

i5luDyjnitK5Hgh8Ebfrcw.text: Pho Annie is conveniently located on the southern end of Rainbow Blvd, close to Mountains Edge. Despite the convenient location, I still don't eat here very often. Service is okay, it's fast. Food is prepared accordingly and presented nice. My taste buds are not going crazy here! Chicken noodle soup is so boring. The rice noodles are okay. Seafood noodle soup is just okay ... not much of seafood in it, shrimps are too small. Chicken pad thai was good, but nothing special. Pot stickers were tastier! Egg rolls are also good.  I'm not sure if msg is used here. It's not like I want msg, but I can't really tell and I like to know.  Despite the fact that I don't like the food here to much, still I would like to try their Chicken curry soup. So I'm sure I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pad thai
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken rice noodles
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pot stickers

FX7CVwyateSha9WGVLoIbQ.text: Oh man oh man.....what happened to this place???? I used to absolutely love this place! I think Annie sold it.... The service is ok but the food.....just disgusting. Our 5spiced squid was covered in thick batter and wasn't even tossed in the spices! This was the biggest part of why we drove all the way over here rather than eating at a pho place only mins away from our house. Big mistake! The pho broth was bland, there were a ton of over cooked noodles and hardly ANY meat! Pretty sad when you ask for meatballs, rare steak and EXTRA tripe and there's hardly any meat at all! I took out half of my noodles and set them onto a side plate for trash and my bowl Was almost empty by then! Horrible!  I will NEVER RETURN! I'm good with Spring Mtn options.

Y0WWWLLWddAamYYboFtFUw.text: If you're like me you've got to be in the right mood for pho. The gargantuan bowl of broth and experience of noodles hanging out of your mouth just requires the right amount of hunger and patience. Pho Annie definitely has upped my pho mood frequency!   An expansive (but not expensive) menu of pho along with delicious appetizers to choose from (the Vietnamese spring rolls are fresh and delicious) makes this an easy week night outing or a chill weekend meal. The chicken curry pho, as many have mentioned, is seriously tasty with massive pieces of chicken and a perfectly seasoned broth. ADDICTIVE.   Resist the urge to get take out so you can slurp your noodles free of judgment, I felt the portions were a bit smaller for the same price and you miss out on all the accoutrements like hoisin sauce, sprouts and limes.

sqN3OQMbp11483vmt0cjXg.text: If want traditional food this is your spot. I ordered the spicy curry chicken which was in a soup form with all bone. I didn't try the fried rice or pho. The steam rice was not cooked fresh since it was so clumpy. I didn't want water but they kept filling half glass they gave. Three people checked in on me to see  if I or the food was ok. There was floating chicken skin pieces in my bowl maybe for taste. Nothing seemed healthy or special about this place other than the service. I didn't realize the curry chicken came in a soup format and my stomach is still bubbling.

6nFcJ67u5_ecUjpWirRSoQ.text: Love the atmosphere in here! Amazing service, repainted establishment, and their portions are amazing for the price. It's a gem of Las Vegas.

yCvUQH0XQDPh3hNIdQOi-w.text: Vietnamese food here is good. The best I've had in Vegas since I just moved here. I ordered their bun bo hue and it was delicious. They have everything in it that bun bo hue suppose to be. Don't think you can go wrong with anything here. Service was kind of slow when I came here but they looked busy. Overall I would come back for the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ordered the bun bo hue hue. Their food was good.

dYxvrY03wIACIf_F92_7pA.text: I usually go to Jenni Pho to get my pho fix, but wanted to try this place since it's a block closer to my house than Jenni Pho lol.  Friendly staff, very clean and fast service. I only order one type of pho anywhere I go & it's the rare steak pho. Broth was really good, and I felt like they had a pretty good selection of food. I will definitely be coming back here :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak pho with sriracha of course :)

d2seBzYMYCOdl8pSON2Y2A.text: My gf and I enjoy going to this location. It is limited on seating but that doesn't stop us from coming back. They have great food and if you are picky about your pho broth they have flavorful broth. My gf is very picky and this is one of the few places in town she enjoys coming to. My last visit I ordered Thai Tea and they refilled it for me for free. Which was nice since most places charge you extra now for Thai tea refills. They have pretty good customer service and portion sizes are just right!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chops
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai tea

JMANuqsIozoHBK_L-pxL6Q.text: This is our favorite pho place by far. I've never had a bad meal here! The staff is friendly and the service is always great and quick.

7dQBo8hWuBpHsZPJ8mEOpA.text: After 20 plus years of looking for a good pho restaurant, I finally found my favorite pho spot in Vegas! Every time I go to this restaurant, I have not been disappointed yet! Service is fast, food is delicious and it is convenient from where I live and work.  Ambiance: When you walk in, it is not your typical pho spot. It is very small and very family oriented. It is located on Rainbow and after Windmill where a lot of homes and businesses are located. The owners did a great job with location because the area is always busy. The restaurant also welcomes you with a clean area and friendly workers who make you feel comfortable. I am very impressed with the location and decor of the restaurant.  Quality: At first, my friend told me to go to the restaurant but I was hating because I did not care for which "pho" restaurant I go to. I thought it all tasted the same, but was  I WRONG! There is something about their broth that is very different from all the other Vietnamese pho restaurants I have been to (not to mistake Cambodian pho... because it is THE BEST PHO)! The food is so good here. I have tried their pho, rice dishes and basically everything on their appetizers. I also have tried their coconut desserts and their delicious Vietnamese coffee!  Service: The service here is fast and convenient. I never have to worry to get my water cup filled or if I need something, someone is always there to tend to me. It is a family owned business so there is always someone who is taking care of me when I come. I love their service and how they take care of their customers no matter how busy the restaurant can get!  This is my favorite pho place and I cannot wait to try their other items on the menu. This is definitely a place to give a try from the other common pho places in Las Vegas!

U3830XWSaKGE2AEfUWaKcQ.text: I've eaten here on several occasions, each time receiving great service. The staff is fairly quick to get you seated. I've never had to wait for more than 15+ min on my orders. I always get and recommend #12 for all the meat lovers out there. It's a combo of all the meats in one! What more can you ask for? Overall the staff is quick on their feet, friendly and provide quality food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #12 Pho Combo(meat)

5_vaT6rNYVDbay5qJ80FNA.text: Edit: Now I know why this place has changed. It has new owners! It used to be Pho Annie but the new owners gave it a "clever" similar name. Fooled me....at first.  The veggie pho used to be great, now its just water. The staff has also completely transformed. They're nowhere near as nice or as accommodating. You'll be lucky to even catch them glimpsing to see if you're okay on water. After two years of coming here, no more. Good luck!

W-5KQP5KSiIQtY0XE2oPxg.text: This was my first time and i gotta say the service was excellent. The food tasted amazing, however towards the end of my meal i noticed something in my water.  He did apologized but no doscount nor try to make it right. I still tipped.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Found something in my water... uh

xxajJjIg0-2B8c3dliDipw.text: The food is good, the price is right, the people are nice. The only reason that I am giving this place 3 stars is because in the middle of summer, the thermostat is set for 83 degrees. How can anyone sit and relax and enjoy their meal when they are dripping sweat. Sorry Pho Aimie, we will try again in the winter.

3OodKnnv2LToEwGsdJMydQ.text: This is the best Pho I've had since I left Minneapolis... It is delicious. Annie is full of spunk and I like her. The food was great and it's a cool little place. My husband had the grilled pork chop with egg and rice and it was a really good portion size for the price.   We will definitely be back!

sn_0W8jqNH9jq1WBz8qmZg.text: We are avid Pho eaters and usually do Kim Long, but didn't feel like waiting. Annie's broth is good, not as good as KL. Spring rolls were a good size, bigger than KL. Atmosphere was quieter and more calm than KL. Bathrooms were cleaner than KL. Plus no long wait! Quite a nice find.

1CdhOyfj-nLy6b4hNEcVLg.text: i fucking love pho annie ! i crave their pho everyday. I have eaten there 5 days in a row before because that is how addicted I am to this place.

ExBHq-IoeHeaRus1q9MiYg.text: Not a good experience.  Ordered a to go order for just one pho and stood at the counter for just over 10min before anyone chose to acknowledge me.  I said excuse me and was popping my head into the kitchen and everyone just stared at me.  When someone did finally acknowledge me it was to tell me the food wasn't ready yet.  Mind you I was quoted 10min and showed up 20min later.  By the time someone spoke to me 30min had passed since I ordered.  The pho was really good, but not worth the bad service I received.

XXpzAV6GnvtXr-8USzFNuQ.text: Best pho place I've been to. It's clean and friendly. All the food looks and tastes fresh. I highly reccomend

COrYAcSQX-CBZcQhgvZ_JQ.text: Had the vietnamese egg rolls, rare steak and tendon  pho.  My daughter had grilled lemongrass chicken.  Not bad for your neighborhood Pho restaurant.....quick service and friendly staff.  If you're in the southwest part of the city you have Jenni Pho and that's it.  I would have say the broth here is better than Jenni Pho.  So good job Annie Pho you better than Jenni.........but Pho Kim Luong has to be the best in the city.

9WPxNSgv5PnYd4aCHJ0ztg.text: Wanted to try this place since it is close to my house. Called to try and place online order and a guy answered the phone practically yelling at me. Called me stupid and hung up. Then my boyfriend called back..he starts placing the order an then the line just goes silent. We call back and he answers and hangs up. Don't know what is up with this place but the guy was seriously playing games on the phone and we were so irritated.

v_36qstf5O17tmqiHpxN_Q.text: This place has amazing pho & awesome service. All of their prices are really cheap as well. We received our food really fast & I don't think our waiter let my drink get passed the half way mark at any point! I had a really awesome experience & I will definitely be going back soon.   Oh & a person wrote a bad review about the waiter mistaking their beef strip for tripe. If you would of asked the waiter they would of told you that it is a menu typo & that it's suppose to say tripe. There is no such thing as beef strip.

crK7UrrdfCaZeDnRdDRExw.text: This is our go to Vietnamese place since it's the closest place in the Mtns Edge area.  We always order the same thing.  Sometimes I try something different but end up going back to my go to. Sometimes we're here at least once a week.

krnATdpzQGXXTl8jO6NUGg.text: Out of all the Pho places I've been to, so far this place is my favorite! The broth is rich & full of flavor. And a bonus since it's right in my neighborhood!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho Ga! Best pho broth I&#39;ve had so far in Vegas!

u-2h6hX-ovtcUTSOytNRGA.text: I dont have alot of experience with Vietnamese food, have maybe gone out for it 3 times. But in my meager experience this place was great! It was 8pm on  Saturday night and they were busy! We were lucky and didn't have to wait for a table. Right away they brought water and ask if we want to order so we got some lychee drinks (lychee and ice with a boba straw) refreshing, saved mine mostly for the ride home. We ordered the shrimp spring rolls which were fresh and delish that they serve with a sweet peanut sauce. Also gotta have pho, we got the seafood. It was good but not crazy about it, I will stick with the beef next time. We wanted to not just have pho so we stepped it up and got the pork chops it came with fried egg rice veggies and soup for like $10! And it was really really tasty! Also the service was good and friendly. We felt welcomed and appreciated!  Im knocking a star because we waited for the veggies for the pho. And the old coffee shop decore doesn't go but it does give it some character!  I am excited its on the south side of town. We will be eating here and ordering pick from here often!

pwtUYIGLCNccypzwuKfbkg.text: Delicious pho broth and an excellent beef chow fun. I like that they have other non-Vietnamese options on the menu in addition to the traditional stuff. Ambiance is nice, lighting is much nicer than Sammy Pho. Could use some music though. Staff is friendly and attentive.

Syjruwt2fWMVSgeh-jdwGw.text: First time here, second time having Pho. I got the #14, Well done pho noodle soup. I really enjoyed it. The broth was very tastey. Also ordered the Beef Chow Fun. That too was just as yummy! Ordered for a take out and it took no more than a 10 minute wait.  Will definitely be coming back for more.

u68o0Ko3S7E7phkx15Rxbw.text: This is my second experience having Pho. With that caveat, I have come to the conclusion to expect limited floor space and staffing to keep overhead low. I had dinner to go and it was very busy, not an empty table. Calling in was an "experience" I would liken to speaking to someone whose English is just OK while they're at a rock concert; lots of "WHAT?!", "REPEAT?!"Surprisingly he got the order factually correct but forgot the broth and I had to return.  I had the the recommended Chicken Curry Noodle Soup. It should be noted the chicken pieces are rough cut with bone in. It has a traditional appeal but it was delicious and I will frequent again despite certain limitations I have come to expect from Pho restaurants. It's small, family staffed and very busy with a lot of turnover. Call ahead and get it to go. 15-20 minutes.

rX-cjCFcJklqOdabwKLC1Q.text: My very favorite place to eat, food is always fresh, fast, delish! Staff is attentive and courteous, atmosphere is relaxed and comfy - they just opened a new location on S Grand Canyon/Russell and it is just as good as the first. Matter of fact I think Ill go tonight for dinner!

yAS1YsFpv1H8hBQO_7-vcQ.text: Wow! Some of the best to go pho I've ever had! I love that they keep everything separate so it doesn't lose any of the flavor. Often times the beef gets tough after sitting in the broth too long, not here! The meal was ready quickly and was fresh and delicious.

WhXYjF-3ZhZPc4kpSnJGfQ.text: Simply some of the best I've ever had -- and I try to make it myself as a committed Pho eater.

RUuGyDyfXOwXBVEHwpTRcA.text: I like the Bun with grilled shrimp.  Pho Tai is also delicious.  I don't know what they do but it seems that their soup had some kind of thickening agent, like starch or gelatins. Very flavorful.  Also like the fried rice with omlet

2xuEChpX6B4ZCDjOQjCnjw.text: Service is great. Pho has lots of flavor and prices are perfect. I come here often whenever I'm craving soup. This is the spot to go.

yg4N-R5MxBK1lQ4Xf01Khg.text: Love this place. There's a couple Vietnamese restaurants around my house and this is the best. Their broth is so delicious. And the duck soup is to die for. Half a duck for 9.99. There's only a couple things I hate. The service and the dinning room. You have to get lucky to be seated right away.

VMMqxi4s-nHEhlEhCLuS6Q.text: Wasn't really impressed with the taste of the food. I ordered the vermicelli with beef and was a little disappointed. Flavor is ok but nothing special. They do give you a generous amount of food though. More than enough to make you really full. The best Vietnamese places are the ones near Chinatown on Spring Mountain road. Should've went there instead but opted to go here since we were in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YAvmAoZH5UnxDddUfY28aw.text: Came here again after a successful night of celebrating with my friends and I think the management changed or something cuz overall this place has turned into my favorite Pho restaurant   The food, price and service are A+ imo. Better than the other Pho places ive tried in this neighborhood.   Get the potstickers if you are feeling like an appetizer cuz they seem like the put something in the meat and I want to buy them so I can make it at home.

k1VBWdiRW7D0JdGPpGcGVA.text: This is my go-to pho place, I absolutely love it here. The staff is so nice and friendly, the place looks very clean and the food is great! My best friend and I have lunch here about 2-3x a month, we both love it!

zP0bkhiyuVexqDcZE8ZFHA.text: I've had Pho Aimie a few times since I've moved here, but it's usually eaten at home as a pick-up order. Nothing beats comfort broth after a long weekend out! I really like the com thit nuong here because it comes with an egg on top, and you can ask for cha on the side. They don't have bi, however, which is a shame because that is a Vietnamese staple. The owners seemed pretty nice (from our minimal interaction over the phone), and spoke to me politely in Vietnamese. I also like that they have the option of getting a large pho broth on the side for less than $3 if you're not really up for eating pho noodles and want other entrees - although, the pho broth needs a little work because I can only drink so much before I get that overwhelming MSG taste. Hey if I can get my Vietnamese fix on this side of town, then I'm not going to be complaining too much!

Qn6ubQqwJZYQEUtRi-LL0w.text: Thier good. Sometimes the wait is a lil longer than usual, but it's ok. Solid 4 stArs

9Dnu3dWRC9kz51zGEBjEMg.text: There are some many Pho restaurants in Las Vegas. Unfortunately not all are good. Thank goodness that Pho Anime is a really good one.   This restaurant is in Rainbow, closest to Blue Diamond. It would seem to me that the location is odd as it is out of the way. So I was pleasantly surprised that the food here was good. In fact, the few restaurants in this area have 4+ yelp ratings.  Because of its location, it makes a "best kept secret". Truly a neighborhood gem. I'm looking forward to winter and the cold weather to enjoy this Asian comfort food.   And the customer service? Outstanding!

bmbHsPAPaCGZUcJza7DUuA.text: This was the most delicious thing after a night of drinking in Vegas. All I was craving was pho and I am glad my friends were craving the same thing. Pho Aimie was only 7 minutes away from my vacation house so it was easy to get there. Also, we were able to order and get our food within 10 minutes. I ordered the Pho Ga (Chicken Pho) with Vegetarian broth since I do not eat beef. The soup tasted just like the regular chicken pho which was perfect. I also ordered a side of egg rolls to share with my boyfriend.  The noodle portion was perfect and seemed like a lot, especially for the price. The customer service was great as well. I can not wait to be back for a hangover cure next month!

nQuwmwCND9dVI6QjrjMaKw.text: Came here and few times and this restaurant never disappoints.  We ordered the chicken wings with butter garlic sauce and the chicken pho.  The wings came out hot so be careful when diving in right away.  The flavor (not too garlicky) and crispiness was excellent (I usually order my wings well done but it's not needed) - 3/5.  The chicken pho originally comes with beef broth but you can ask for chicken broth as a substitute.  The broth is delicious, probably the best chicken pho I have ever had in vegas - 5/5.  The service was also excellent!

1tnmsPUP0q-nbs4cIhw2kw.text: I had the BBQ porkchops, my wife has the Veggie Pho. The porkchops was nice, juicy, and tasty. My wife's Veggie Pho had nice chunks of veggie, broccoli, baby bok choy, carrots, and mushrooms. The broth was also very tasty given it was vegan. I cant wait to try the Rare steak pho! will be back.

9wtB4qOZJQFfm49N22JguQ.text: How haven't I wrote a review already? I've been coming here for about three years. I love the customer service, friendly faces, and amazing broth. Definitely one of the best pho places in Vegas.

MJttHJT9snpyYMmWgWf3_A.text: I would choose this Pho restaurant anytime compare to any other Pho restaurant. I love they're Pho!

iLYaLm8G6Oy2XvVO9i2NSw.text: I order the rare steak & meatball pho and the chicken wing appetizer to go. I was told my order would be ready in 15 mins. I arrive there 25 mins later. My food was never made and was rushed once I arrived. The chicken wings I order were burnt and the pho has a very bland flavor. I would not recommend there pho to anyone. There are a lot of other places that are better if you are willing to make the drive.

L6EXTlDzeYam_u8CgDlAQg.text: My husband and I have been searching for a new Pho place ever since the place we liked changed owners but we found this place not far from our house almost same distance and from the moment your seated the staff is pleasant and quick. The food is really good and we're excited that it was  on the money again ; so we're now super excited to try some of there other entrees we'll definitely be back

kfQT9EDAsPwWz5lC--h8dA.text: I never do reviews but this place is great!I had the pho with beef and it was beyond amazing.I have tried others they do no compare and will drive across town for this place!It was delicious friendly fast and very clean!

-H4T7mTSykAQUetaLFPQcA.text: Ordered a veggie noodle soup and asked for veggie broth and they said they'll do. Once I got my order it was not veggie broth it was chicken broth.  I was not satisfied.

ovrNYjdo6gFdTT8T6-_KDA.text: I absolutely love that this place is right around the corner from my house. I Love their spicy chicken fried rice!

K4t9uiefDPFHYSj0VRkI7w.text: Small space, quick friendly service.  Food was good, we had spring rolls (very fresh and good sauce) and we  both had shrimp pho.   But the restaurant and seats were a little old and run down.

K5puwOfXUOW_cVTHQGve8g.text: The food is still good but we were disappointed to find our garlic wings without fresh garlic anymore. It was less tasty. The pho broth was more watery than usual still service is great but bring back the old recipes

24D-g3CI9HMWoCEQ0DPDTQ.text: This is our go to pho place because it's literally 2 minutes down the street from our home and the pho brother isn't super salty/sweet like some places. The ambience is casual and the restaurant is kind of small.   The pho is pretty good and with the many pho places on this side of town I feel like it is one of the better ones. Sometimes we get their garlic chicken appetizer which is super delicious.   The service is a hit or miss. Some days you'll get the super attentive server and other days you'll get someone who's overwhelmed and checks on you just once.   We keep coming back regardless of the service and choose this over any close pho place on this side of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JlfvDfc8X9EddXaafMOFIw.text: A large selection to choose from and huge portion sizes! The food is great and the servers are quick to serve your food and always maintain a friendly demeanor. If you're on the Southwest area this is the place to stop at!

CjS_kfXULnXzAgLWWCsJdQ.text: The food here was so flavorful and balanced. Every bite took me on a roller coaster through my taste pallet. The Pho broth was so flavorful but was mild enough that it wasn't too over powering. I had the lemon grass chicken which I definitely recommend. And the service was great especially from Patrick!

pFKpy952TFJskRcP9ICp-A.text: We've come here various time for dine-in and take out. My fiance and I think the place is good, but we find the service inconsistent. There are times when the service is of an exceptional grade and there are times when we are standing at the register waiting to be seated. Overall though the experience isn't that bad and at its worst its bearable.   The food is where this place shines. My fiance is Vietnamese and she thinks the food is delicious, i concur with that assessment. I love their rice dishes, Im filipino, and for some reason i dont think a meal is complete without rice. My fiance says their soup dishes are flavorful and good.  Had to take off a star because of service but overall the experience is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mai cu thieu sate. Spicy goodness.

dD-Zx-x5hDjhMRxrpNsMww.text: Pho Annie was great until new management, found a cockroach in my pho. This place is no good. Please stop going here. This place should we shut down.

t8Rb-BXbBFzLXngeruGqZQ.text: If you live south Las Vegas then stop here instead of pho Kim long. Save you gas and a couple bucks. Food quality is just as good if not slightly better with bigger portions!! I ordered the fried egg over fried rice and its bomb! Also the pork/ egg roll vermicelli, highly recommend!   Overall very satisfied and full and didn't hurt the wallet. Will come back again for sure!

_horKcud4IsBMEZvMq3QOg.text: Really in the mood for soup and always heard good things about this place, but never tried it out. Decided to give it a shot Friday night. Years ago I lived sooooo close to this place and always seemed to drive right passed it. I even dined at that Cheeburger place (gross) once.    As I walk in and survey the area, I see that the dining area is a little small. Lots of the tables were occupied. Decided then that I'll take my order to go, since I was alone anyway. I did like that they had some college basketball on the tv...major props for that. Place looked very clean and well kept...another plus in my book.   My chopstick skills suck, so I was glad to take my order to go and just save the embarrassment of me getting stuff everywhere but my mouth. I ordered the chicken curry soup. Normally, soup is something you don't take to go. It needs to be nice and hot, straight out of the kitchen (also, one sharp turn in my GTI and it could be all over my interior). The order didn't take long to be prepared. Got home and put all the ingredients together. This soup is amazing!  I don't wanna sound corny, but I'm gonna be on my Guy Fieri ish.. Pho Annie too me to flavor town! There was such an array of flavors, from the chili sauce, to the curry, to the jalapeno, to the lime. Everything came together so perfectly. I even enjoy having the chicken not boneless. It's like a little soup scavenger hunt to find the chicken and tear it apart with your hands.   Great food. I will return. Looking forward to trying the other dishes available.

-bUEgDJuyfIStT_Qy_0zIQ.text: The pho was good and hit the spot after a weekend of partying it up in Vegas, but it left me feeling super thirsty. Must've been the MSG! I got the special, which is number 12, instead of number 1. How odd. Haha. It included rare beef, tripe, beef balls, and tendon. I only spotted about two small pieces of tendon. I enjoyed the beef balls.  Most specials/dac biet don't include them. My boyfriend strayed from the norm and got their curry noodles, which is a special item. It is a coconut based curry soup with chicken. My boyfriend friend enjoyed it, but I say mama makes it better. ;) I would suggest it if you are feeling like pho but want soup noodles.

_jO0_uB95vklUDuJ8Pvt-g.text: Good Vietnamese food is hard to find on the Westside, so if you don't feel up to driving all the way to Spring Mountain, I suggest going here. Service is a hit or miss, since they always seem to be short-staffed. Just last night I saw a potentially large party leave since they weren't acknowledged for a long time. I also had to flag down a server multiple times to get the soup that was supposed to come with our order, and re-ask for our drinks (even after that, we were still one short). One of the empty plates we had weren't thoroughly cleaned and had remnants of a spring roll wrapper on it, we didn't even bother letting them know about the issue. In any case, the food is pretty consistent. I prefer the pork rice plate which comes with an over easy egg and a side of plain broth. My husband likes the shaken beef, which is a higher quality beef. Parking is easy here and  they do take-out so shaky service aside, people will still keep this place busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried egg roll
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chow fun
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon grass chicken

2db2-RCjR-_lVyRHGejOuA.text: Huge portions! The bowls of Vermicelli were larger than my head! Filled to the brim with authentic herbs, veggies and noodles and with the right amount of meat.   Some people complain about the amount of meat they offer here but I like my food heavy on the veggies and use the meat more as a flavoring agent.   Everything tasted fresh and the restaurant was clean.

62LYBnMqDj7NtUFD5u5NDA.text: So, we've been here at least once a week since moving into the neighborhood.  The owner Annie is bubbly and reminds me of a younger version of my mom.  Are her dishes as good as my mom's? Hmm, not quite, but who's ever is, right??   Anyways, I've tried the chicken pho (pho ga), crab soup (bun rieu), grilled pork with rice (com thit nuong), combo beef pho (dac biet) and  the roast duck/wonton egg noodle soup (Mi Vit quay).  My favorite? For sure, the roast duck and wonton noodle soup- which is more of a Chinese dish than Vietnamese BUT, it actually is pretty damn tasty and I don't have to drive to Chinatown each time I'm craving duck :)  But all the other dishes are actually not bad either- I've had bad pho before and theirs is not bad at all, in fact, it's good enough that I actually brought my mom there!  Let's just say it started off a little rocky with mom, but overall she said it's pretty good and that the soup base for the wonton noodle and her chicken pho had lots of flavor. Guess that's a win :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Broken rice with grilled pork and fried egg, I added shredded pork and eggrolls!!
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast duck wontons and egg noodles..almost like Mom&#39;s :)

OesVpBHhW_nBp_tLgiNZyw.text: I love pho, so instead of driving all the way to China Town, this is our "go to" pho spot. Its close to our house and you can't go wrong with the food. Affordable, quick service and the food is always on point.   The only a few things that suck tho, the drive thru isn't open. Literally, its blocked with the boss or employees car. So, for the lazy people, you gotta go inside to pick up your food. Another thing, the restaurant is narrow so its pretty small inside leaving you feeling crammed. When waiting for a table on a busy night, prepare to stand by the entrance door to get a table. Lastly, the last time we ate there, our server smelt like overpowering cigarettes and our table was sticky....BUT, NOTE: the tables are always sticky.   Overall, I still recommend this place if you're in the area, Food is still yummy! Ratings go down for the other stuff

nAm_53iNAzYNbyTPri2Tfg.text: We began with an order of Vietnamese egg rolls served with Romaine leaves and a light fish sauce that were crunchy and flavorful.  For entrees my wife and I each ordered bowls of the highly acclaimed spicy chicken curry soup that came with fresh bean sprouts, lime and slice of jalapeno.  The soup was spicy as advertised and loaded with both noodles and bone in chicken, but we felt it would have been better with a more generous helping of coconut milk.

Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. egg rolls

sH3gXhbPlQ9GMlUWoVI_aA.text: I was in the area for a meeting and decided to stop in for lunch since this was right by. The reviews seemed good and I was really in the mood for Pho. I was escorted to my table quickly and the server took my ordered right away. Within five minutes I had my stealing bowl of Pho with accompaniments. After the first sip of the broth I knew I had just tasted the best Pho in Vegas! I have tried different Pho in China Town but NONE compare to Pho Annie! The meat was tender and the accompaniments were fresh. The jalapeno slices had just enough kick to round out the broth. And that broth... Wow, they have it perfected. I have bookmarked this place in the hopes of remembering to eat here again when I'm in the area. This place is a most stop for anyone who enjoys a good bowl of Pho!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #17 was the best!!!

zLApD5SNuP2elCQ_UFQfRQ.text: I checked this place out for the first time, just to grab takeout on my way to my friends house. Now, i'll give them the benefit of the doubt and chalk the slow service up to what seemed to be a pretty sudden rush of guests, but it did take me over twenty minutes to be greeted and get my order taken, which was a bit offputting, and constitutes most of my reasoning for the 3-star rating. At least greet someone when they are waiting at the counter.   When i did get greeted, i will say i was happy with how nice the gentleman was who finally took my order... and very apologetic!  Needless to say i was pretty hungry by the time i got to where i was going, and when i opened the expertly boxed-up food, it was definitely a generous portion and filled me right up! (i love the little sriracha and hoisin sauce packets!)   However, i found the broth to be sweeter than i like and the meat was fine but it seemed to be missing something overall. In this sense i much prefer pho saigon 8 in henderson or pho Kim Long in chinatown.  I am, though, fully willing to give them a second chance and maybe try the curry soup as I've heard it is to die for!

6wTFXJh3X6E4XRbN1yFwcA.text: Very good , I love PHO and this place is very clean , service was great and the food was amazing ! BBQ pork with egg noodle is my favorite and the beef stew was tasty!!

7o2-zaw0w80-DN6qQQqDyg.text: The pork was amazing. Service was very good. It is a must. Everything is very reasonably priced. I'd def come back.

2d0KbgMdVvMcbXFAcjliqg.text: The best pho in town I enjoyed a small contemporary restaurant The owner is very extremely nice and funny excellent service

TQteSE6GXk0vlb03WxbiKg.text: I'm vegetarian except I will eat a little seafood sometimes when I eat out. There were very limited vegetarian options. I ordered the veggie pho. I wanted it to be good because this restaurant is the closest place for pho near my house. But sadly it was just plain. The veggies and tofu were done right but the broth was basically tasteless. I felt like the only flavor in it was from all the sauces I kept adding, which of course unhealthily adds a bunch of sodium. I also ordered shrimp spring rolls. They too were very plain. I'm told they normally come with pork inside, but I had that exempted. It was just noodles, romaine lettuce and flavorless shrimp. I've had WAY better spring rolls.   My order was for take out. On the service side of things I have no complaints. They were fast and friendly, but I doubt I'll go back. They just weren't good enough on the veggie side of things.

Odm2yHD9m6aTjHoY_q2xMQ.text: The food was delicious. The egg roles were crazy good and the chicken pho was delicious as well. I will come back soon. The service was fast and friendly and I highly recommend to go and try it out yourself.

_eP5CwyYw1k0XeaR9HmKeQ.text: I use to come here at least once a week. But recently they changed owners and I think the old owner took all of her staff with her. Food isn't the same very disappoint. The broth for the chicken pho lacks flavor.

ZlsTZLboZipGcUiPUJNAkQ.text: Horrible service. We walked in when it was empty to order food to go for work and it took 10 mins for anyone to even notice us. After reading the great reviews I though the food sounds like its worth the wait. When I got to my job our pho had none of the chicken or meat that we ordered so we only had the noodles and broth. I immediately called back and explained that I couldn't come back at the moment but what their procedures were for this. The guy told me that they were busy so to come the next morning and they would refund me. So I went and the owner Annie went completely crazy shushing me out saying that the guy who answered the phone didn't know what he was talking about and saying she didn't care what he said that she's in charge and she can't help us. _7vbzBoNKD7j3fRfxnw3tw.text: I'm digging their vegetable tofu pho! To die for! #AnniePho @LasVegas_Now YUMYUM! Best pho place @LasVegas_Places

Ht9NpytuVAd1kmC8o8T_rg.text: I had the chicken rice noodle soup and it was good, so was the fried eggroll. My husband had the chicken curry soup, I didn't care for that very much. Their thai coffee was good. I would definitely go back.

q8JYsKtXbErv_HU1GHsZ-A.text: Good food and very affordable and big servings wow! And it's near my place to. Check it out you won't be disappointed.

HZpZvBfRvrsgKM7cHR91UA.text: The food here is consistently good, but my biggest peeve about this place is the service. It's not consistent and as tolerant as I try to be, they have a hard time understanding you sometimes, and that worries me when I am ordering food. Regardless, they have a good variety of food. Their main menu is probably the pho, but there are a lot of Thai food items. Definitely a good place to stop by if you live in the Southwest and don't feel like driving to Chinatown.

RDGUNltAuCdieJ1362NQNA.text: Great place to get something tasty. Flavor is on point. Good chill spot to grub. one of my favorite spots in Vegas. Not over crowded.

Lk-dMaq8-BJacDN56gD5DQ.text: Had the pho with beef balls and rare steak. It was by far the best I've ever had!! The broth and meat was so delicious and all the food came out immediately. Definately coming back here all the time. I reccomend this place to anyone and everyone.

U2SQ1zqXcOi1g7psReqF3g.text: Service was great! She even gave us complimentary Thai iced teas- 4 of them! My family and I have been here twice.. In one week!! The egg rolls are delicious. My three year old devours them! I recommend the seafood pho, shrimp pho and the seafood pan fried crispy noodles with gravy. We just moved here from Cali and we are pho fanatics! Thank goodness we found a spot the whole family likes!

Zk1mPUk7XHSeAYm8zvYrjw.text: I love this place! I just tried Pho Annie with couple of friends the other day and have been here now 3 times this week for lunch. It's fantastic in my opinion. I'm only giving it four stars because I've only had pho at handful of other places. Otherwise, this would definitely be my first five star review.  I've seen reviews that service sucks at Pho Annie, but I have no idea where that's coming from. Have you been to Jason's Deli? Every time I come to Pho Annie (well, this week) they greet me at door in about 2 seconds and take my order within 2 minutes. Within about 5 minutes after you order you have your food. This place is sick.   I've been getting the steak and beef brisket pho (I think it's #16 or #17 on the menu). It's great and in pretty ridiculous amounts for only $6.99. You get a crazy amount of the soup and noodles plus the standard sides (bean sprouts, jalapenos - ask for more - and fresh Thai basil). It's just like sitting in the streets of Saigon or something the produce is so fresh . Freaking awesome! One my friends ordered the #1 (or as it seemed - mystery meat combo).  It was only described in Vietnamese on the menu. As a big fan of Thai food I figured from experience this was probably organ meats...and it was. Basically tripe, tendons (which look like wieners of an unidentified animal) and some roast beef in thin slices. If you're not adventurous, I wouldn't go for it your first time. It's also great that they don't ask you what you'd like to drink. They bring you water and that's what you have. I love that you don't have to make a decision between Pepsi or Sprite.  I also love the fact that  the ambiance is somewhat questionable. I'm pretty familiar with the area having lived in Spring Valley for a while and worked in the area as well for sometime. Everything in that area is very generic and nice - and incredibly boring. I hate that and prefer culture over comfort. The decor is sort of like Asian restaurant meets depressing IHOP booths, which I like a lot. However, it's incredibly clean, but small (love that).  Nevertheless, the kitchen is open viewing for all customers and looks really spotless with fresh sprouts, jalapenos and basil in full view.   I love Pho Annie and will probably come back for a long time. It's an awesome place with awesome food and awesome service. I'm sold.

t2jErE5Hk_P7qPw0VJ8JKg.text: Came here on a visit to my sisters' and this was the closest pho place. Too bad I'm on a vegetarian stint so I couldn't try their pho. But we had their hu tieu Xao Chay which was really interesting! Their noodles were fried and cut into slices and the veggies were on the bottom which you ate together. This might not be on the menu but you can still ask them! The portion size was huge and I shared with my sister and we both got full. We also got some yummy fresh fruit drinks. My sister got the fresh coconut juice that came in a coconut and I got their lycee drink. Both were refreshing! The service was nice as well.

CHZqRiD98T57k9CQ6-KYRQ.text: HUGE menu! The broth is fantastic. Pho makes everything better. The egg rolls and spring rolls are also amazing. Try the duck pho if you wanna get crazy.

zwIXcziSAzG9Eta7dtY5Jw.text: I love this place for lunch.  Most of their food are authenticate enough, even for a Vietnamese dude like me.

r_ZWny7bc1D7yOTnAnoy8Q.text: Love this place!. It's the best Pho we've had and no cilantro in the soup! Friendly, clean and very close to our house! Delicious! Definitely give it a try if you've never had it!

7YTtzgAuuLN8-Oi2_raApw.text: The best Chicken Pho I've ever had!!!!!! The only Pho I did not have to add hoisin sauce or siracha.  Amazing without it!

IddsbKIrkkq44wqa-Cudog.text: Neighborhood Pho Restaurant!  I think the food is pretty good, price is fair, and large portions.

KaC4z76Z5VJirV1VFw1UoQ.text: We enjoy a good pho place..! Typically these places are not that nice (aesthetically), but don't let that be the judge of the food. This place, however, was really nice place. The service came sincerely, food was great, and the price was about a $1 less than most pho places I have been too.

-p6vrQsMth2sM4SYAkXJeg.text: Been coming here for a long time but don't think we will return. Mainly only dine here due to proximity to home. Quick and easy to get to. When we first started dining here, service was great and food was pretty decent. Annie, the owner, gives great service and constantly smiles and is courteous and gracious. She remembers my family and where we prefer to sit whenever we dine in. Although we've had some positive experiences, we've also had just as many negative ones. On several occasions when we order for take out, there is often confusion or problems with our order..and we only order 2 things! I blame this mainly on the guy that takes our order. I don't know his name but my guess is by the way he is dressed and the tasks he handles, that he is related to the owner, Annie. I don't know if he's a brother, or a husband, but he's mainly the one seating and waiting on customers other than Annie. This guy is awful. Messed up our order several times..simple things like, no onions in our Pho, or extra sauce, chapsticks..wrong amount provided on the phone for the bill, arriving to pickup takeout order and not being acknowledged (last time I stood there for almost 10 mins before I was approached, and he looked right at me 4 times!!!  MISSING food (had to drive all the way back for that one!), called and ordered and was told order would be ready in 10 mins, ended up waiting close to half an hour - dude didn't put my order in until I got there!!!! WTF???!! it just sucks because I really want to like this place, and have given it so many chances but it's mainly because this guy screws everything up (it's ALWAYS the same guy that screws things up) that I choose to no longer dine there...dude doesn't even say thank you..and I considered myself one of their regulars! There's just so many other Pho places in town that offer better service, without all the mistakes.   Food is pretty decent, like I said, but is negated by the fact that service sucks so bad (when it isn't the owner), that you lose focus on what your eating and end up thinking about how shitty the service is.   Regardless of of how good the food is, when the last memory of your dining experience is how bad the service is, it's pretty pointless. I come to expect that crap at fast food joints like BK, and McD's, but not a place like this, especially considering there are TONS of Pho places in Vegas that offer comparable food with BETTER service.   Save yourself buyers remorse and look for better options. Service here is inconsistent  at best..and down right shitty at worst.  Note to Annie if you're reading this: I think you personally are quite nice, and enjoy your service, but this guy that works there, get rid of him...your business will slowly dry up because of people like this. If not fire him, don't let him serve customers...let him clean your toilets or mop floors or take out the trash...you don't want someone like that to represent your establishment, considering the service you provide personally is actually decent. Maybe if he's gone I would actually return!

vkV4DuVCupksHIBA2QptoQ.text: Good pho in the southwest, favorite of all of them. I wish they would remember our order when we come in. I can't ever tell if they remember us even though we are there once a week to every other week. But other than the typical way you are treated at a pho place the food is good and quick. Would recommend anyone in the area to their restaurant.

Z7u3IfZTvDTPqma8ptiUuQ.text: This is my absolute favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Las Vegas! Their prices are so cheap for the amount of food that they give you which is literally a huge giant plate. Although I'm a pho kind of girl, their broken rice dishes are absolutely delicious. This will always be my go to place for pho and Vietnamese rice dishes!!!

NWrsNK1n4InTVDHhO3WCHQ.text: Fyi the spring rolls come two in an order not four they just cut it in half. Spring rolls are very good tho.

Perfect flavors with the added bit of heat I needed to clear the sinuses. Great cleanse for my hang over. I will be visiting again soon next time I'm in Vegas.

My husband devoured the chicken curry.  I did the same with the pork bun.  My only complaint is that the condensed milk iced coffee came pre-made.  I usually like to mix it myself so I can go easy on condensed milk.

ZR_zFzRCCycK9B76hTEyQQ.text: Blech! Can you just say this is pure disgust? There pho broth tastes so bland that I might just as well have water as broth with my pho. FXYJt7Uru2n6b1hjj9U-rg.text: Small local Pho restaurant. Better than others from a food and ambiance standpoint. Don't know if I'd drive across town for this place but I live nearby and I will most certainly be back. The sprig rolls there are much better than most other similar establishments I have been to. The sauces were also much more flavorful too. Our server was good too a young lady with tattoos and a bold personality.

YsWvsECR6hSwS2q9eYizqA.text: First time here. I'm a big fan of Pho and usually go to Jenni Pho. The broth was delicious as was the rest of the dish. The noodles were a little over cooked which made them slightly soft when I started the soup and very squishy by the time I got to the bottom. I will come back to this place and include it in the rotation of Vegas Pho

CZYdMODG9GDYzgb9Yw_jNg.text: Bad service! Took my wife and our friends from out of town there. They were busy, and we were very patient with their service but they kept messing up our orders. My wife had to work that day and she had 2 hrs to eat with us. We've waited for an hour for her food and she still didn't get her food. They were also trying to double charge us for something we didn't order. I personally usually like this place but never again will go back! The guy was trying to tell us that the next time we go back he got us! Yea okay? You can't even get the order right from the first place!

519cxjY2EgudQjO_090TcA.text: This place has some good pho! The staff here aren't the most polite (you'd know what I mean if you have Asian aunties), but don't let that affect your visit! For example, the owner, Annie, was looking for fish sauce for another table that somehow did not have any. She happened to notice the full bottle on my table, so she reached over my food with no clear "Excuse me" or "Thank you" (same thing when she came to put it back). I thought it was funny, but I am familiar with this type of "mannerism" so it didn't bother me at all.  My favorite dish on the menu is the crabmeat and tomato pho with vermicelli. There are nicely-sized clumps of crabmeat (Fresh? Imitation? Who cares?), peeled shrimp, wedges of tomatoes, sausage slices, fried tofu, and beef liver, garnished with green onions and what I think is dried fish shavings or something. The broth is bright orange and not spicy at all. I always order this with some Thai Iced Tea. For each soup, they also bring out the usual side of bean sprouts, sliced peppers, basil leaves, limes, etc. I also like their egg rolls and spring rolls with peanut sauce (yummmm!!!). The food usually comes out very quickly, unless they are very busy... which sometimes they are.  The dining area is long and quite limited in seating. There are booths along one side of the wall, with a few tables near the front. The interior is nice and dimly lit with a TV on either end of the room.  Overall, I'd rate this 5 stars based on their menu and location. If you can look past their "mannerisms" you'll really enjoy it here!

u9VVTVhSxcf1TKg41SGMHg.text: One of my favorite places to come for pho. I don't like to have to put extra stuff in mine (sriracha, etc) and this place hits the spot for me.  The pot stickers are really good too.  Overall I have always had a pretty great experience here and they are quick!

li7FJw3FLyGvCXtnJ-P7bg.text: This is definitely one of the better pho restaurants in Vegas. I was there with family about two weeks ago and we had pho. I got the beef stew pho, wife had a chicken curry pho, and my kids had the original pho. All were good and delicious. The broth was amazing and it tasted so good with very bite. I'm glad I found this place. I only go there if we are near IKEA. Customer service is outstanding. Another win for a new pho restaurant in Vegas.

dtDcLoie4RMcE8-M8cEyPA.text: Pho-king awesome.   The flavor is real, everything from the vermicelli, the pho, the broths, the rice dishes, rolls,.. you name it, tastes great. Unbeatable price for the amount and quality they give you and service is ridiculously attentive and nice. Cannot recommend this place enough and it's definitely my conveniently located go-to place for those pho dinner cravings.

XIauZlpAEmZOmvRDC7F09g.text: great service..food is so so..try the grilled pork chop appetizer with a side of white rice.  Very tasty the best thing we had.

VyCZcYgFukWkbkJb45O7tQ.text: First time I loved ! Then was a little sketchy because second time wasn't as good! HOWEVER NOW they are consistent in there portions and quLity and very affordable! I love the owner and chef sweet men very hospitable! Close to home!

Ww-suLzVYWv1I6qNX7WTLQ.text: We come here even though Jenni Pho is closer for all our hangover needs but this past Sunday's visit just might be our last. My man finally walked up to a server and asked if we could sit in one of the empty booths.. We sit.. takes another 10 minutes just to get water and menus.. After a few more minutes pass my boyfriend tries to get one of the server's attention but we are told to "hold on..." At this point we are so irritated. A9tCKXpNt1TA-WLDGv4KtQ.text: Pho Aimie is probably the closest place you can get pho for anyone living in the Southwest part of town.   I decided to order the Pho Tai Nam (Noodle with Rare Steak and Flank) which is usually what I'll order to make fair comparisons between pho restaurants.   The pho was pretty good, but it didn't blow me away. The flank was VERY fatty, so if you're into that, maybe Pho Aimie is for you. Besides that, everything else was about what you'd expect from an average bowl of pho.   If you like fattier meat with your pho, or you don't want to drive far for your Vietnamese fix, Pho Aimie might sound enticing. However, if you're willing to drive an additional five minutes north on Rainbow, Pho Saigon 8 is far superior. But, that's just my opinion, visit both and see for yourself!

cBuEm__1rHUaXX2pQ_-13Q.text: Bowl of warmness...does it get any better?  Been here a few times with my daughter and her BF.  I keep coming back.  The pad Thai is solid.  But what draws me in on this Sunday?  27   A boiling hot bowl of broth with slices of beef, green onion, tomatoes and cucumbers oh and noodles of course!  It taste reminiscent of peanut butter-that's my jam!  I get rice noodles to maintain gluten free.  Along side comes a plate of fresh basil, bean sprouts, jalapeno and lime-dump and squeeze-do it.  Then there is a caddy in the table with two chili garlic sauces.  One is the traditional red and the other is darker red and made in house.  Huge spoonful of that in and wait a minute or two.  Then devour.   Your welcome

NaaxHozv-yFchXDjyqS9DQ.text: Always good- have gotten food to go and have dined in. Soup is excellent so is the pork with egg/rice. Service always friendly.  It's a go to for us.

JXR3yqiej5HwSsk-FdmNNg.text: I've been coming here for years since it was since Pho Rainbow. Pho Rainbow was amazing. Extra rare beef and meat, a big plate of bean sprouts, yummy broth that tasted like it was actually stewing in bone marrow. And the biggest plus was that it was 10 miles closer than driving to Chinatown for pho.  Sadly, this isn't the case anymore since staff and management changed for Pho Annie   Since it changed, food quality can't compare: **Broth seems like it's from the pho broth powder. Not as much meat. Small oval platter of sprouts and mint leaves. Not bad. Just mediocre. It doesn't stand out compared to Chinatown. **Pan fried noodles aren't really Hong Kong style if that's what you want. They use a thicker canton type noodle (instead of thin egg noodles) thats drenched in brown sauce. It's literally a deep dish of noodles with soup filled halfway. Fish taste fishy. (We all know then that it wasn't fresh fish I was eating)  **DEALBREAKER: In the summer, I had Che Ba Mau (3 bean Dessert) that I noticed something was off. My groupmates seemed to brush off my , "does yours taste different to you?" notion while we were there. I finished it halfway before going to discard it but my boyfriend took a bite and gave me the weirdest look....the coconut milk in my dessert was SPOILED. It was sweet but had a sour taste that I took in for "normal" because of restaurant variation.He even gave it to his whole family to try to which they all looked at me in awe cos I actually continued to eat it.  I was so embarrassed.  OVERALL: It's not the worst pho place, I'm sure. It's just that I keep returning hoping it would return back to its glory days. But they seem to let me down. This place is okay for a craving fix, but if you have the time and gas, I'd rather go the extra distance for Chinatown quality.

7e6PvpWednDcQSPArnUXTA.text: If your looking for good quality pho, and you live in the southwest area this place is for you.  The food, - quality is 4/5, the food is really good, the quality of pho is on par with any other good pho place. -My favorite to get is tofu pho with fresh tofu. -Also the spring rolls, they are alright, I wish they came with the cold noodles like other places do.  The service, -customer service 5/5 is great here, it's always busy yet they are very attentive of the customers and their needs. -I order the tofu pho without veggies and fresh tofu and they always make it happen and never complain or make a big fuz about it.  The price, - 4/5 overall not bad but not good. -I have eaten very quality food with bigger portions for cheaper but the distance makes up for that.  The ugly  - not much at all. - thai tea size is small, completely full of ice and very expensive.  Overall great place in the southwest, worth a try -

ShAJARDV27fCRPL8LpvlZA.text: I have a problem giving a good review for good food if the service is the complete opposite.   I took my parents here, they wanting to eat pho, and I hearing from my friends that the Annie Pho near our neighborhood was highly recommended.   In my opinion, this Annie Pho has literally the worst workers I've ever met in my life. I've never met a worker who just completely ignores my family while we patiently wait to order. He sticks his pointer finger at us, and rudely says to "Wait." When we finally get to order, he rushes and cuts us off on our order.  Then, when my mother asks a simple question (can I have more water), he literally just walks past us without batting an eye.   When we finish eating, we have to grab the takeout boxes on the other side of the restaurant ourselves and wait over 10 minutes before being given the bill.   Of course, there was no tip, and I most certainly will NEVER come back.   There's other Pho places out there in the city.

4YWzVVaBKHlijmtAs3fXag.text: This has been my go-to pho place for quite a long time now. I've been to other pho places here in Vegas, but I've always been disappointed with the portion sizes at other pho places. This is the only pho place that can satisfy my truly giant appetite! And it's not overpriced for these giant portion sizes either!  For pho aficionados, you know the first thing you ever do when you're served a bowl of pho is to taste just the broth itself. Proper pho broth requires it to be simmered for 6+ hours and is usually the star of the show. I can definitely taste the love and care they put into their broth. The broth is clean tasting and perfectly compliments the pho noodles. I usually get the combination bowl so I can enjoy all the traditional cuts of meat you put on top of pho.  Service is always top notch and has always been super speedy. Our party has never had to wait long during the numerous times we've come.  When the weekend comes and I'm in the mood for pho, you better believe this is the only place I'll go to get my pho fix.

O05A7v4O1InODalS9hL6bA.text: This used to be the pho place before they switched owners. I used to order their pho at least 2xs a week and it was so good. It had so much flavor and spice that it left me always wanting it again.   I've recently ordered pho, both the tofu and shrimp and the well done flank and it was horrible. They both had no flavor! It tasted like water with a dash of nothing in it.   The broth is by far the most important thing when it comes to pho! I couldn't add anymore jalapenos, sriracha, hosain sauce or onions to even help just a little.   It just isn't the same and I've went back multiple times to make sure it wasn't just an off day and it wasn't. They are just off. I wouldn't recommend them anymore.

No problem, we will just find a place to seat on our own! Once seated, the servers saw us but no one approach us to give us water or even a menu. They just stood at the counter. Come on, the place is not even busy. There was only 2 tables and you there are 2 servers. Not even one server came by. We just stood up and left. vPYxByeCR3ZXG4TXdFf4Gg.text: Great portions of food and fresh vegetables. I recently ate lunch here and had lemon grass chicken stir fry. This is one of the better Vietnamese restaurants in the city as it serves up more authentic versions of the meals offered at a number of establishments. They are also willing to work with a gluten Intolerance and will remove ingredients that they use in dishes that would make them off limits. The lemon grass stir fry bun (,vermicelli rice noodle nowl) was very good. I have also had their curry chicken, which I found less oily than other Vietnamese restaurants, as well as their veggie pho. Both were quite good. I recommend checking this spot out. It is well known for its beef pho, but they have many other delicious options available as well!

lAFvXvieUW31FQUudKXUXQ.text: A favorite Pho house close to my house! My daughter and I come here for the Pho or wonton soup. The broth is good and the servings are huge!  I have also tried other dishes here like the spring rolls and fried noodles, they are decent but not as good as the soup dishes. The prices are competitive with other pho places in the area so it comes down to what taste best to you. This is my daughter's favorite so you know how that goes! Actually, I do like the food here especially the wonton soup- nice on a cold Vegas day.  The service here is quick and friendly. The restaurant itself is updated and clean. Pho Aimie is a good local pho place, serving delicious hot soup and traditional Vietnamese dishes at great prices. Bon Appetit!

Etfkbq6piQOqcMI1sHfxig.text: I love how close this place is to my house! But the down side is that it closes relatively early compared to other boba shops, so you can't get that late night pho fix.  The pho is pretty good. It isn't mind blowing, but it is good authentic pho. I think their soup is key to their pho. They also give a lot of meat which is a huge bonus! Their fresh egg rolls were really good too! A little small though because each roll is half the size of a full one. I'd come here again because of the convenience and good pho.

0iDjQ7LzFaWqRM7FEXudKw.text: Avid pho eater here  me and the hubby eat pho Atleast 2x a week so we know if it's a good PHO place. I'm so glad we found this place and it's close to home. Servers are great, very attentive even though the place gets pretty busy and food is always good and consistent. No complaints Come hungry because they give a generous amount!

23ESJBdLK7TsWfP-Cu98cg.text: Wow!!! This place is one of my friend's favorite Pho restaurants, I didn't even know it existed. Conveniently located on Rainbow Blvd right next to Sparklings bar & restaurant, and The Lodge bar, this is a heck of a noodle place.   You can dine or carry out, and be advised they do not have a liquor license so no wine/beer etc. and no BYO. They do have Coca Cola, water and other canned and bottled soft drinks.   Their menu is huge, there is something for just about every diet. Three of my friends and I dined here a few days ago and it was fantastic. We started with some of the rice paper rolls which had shrimp and were raw (not deep fried). They came with a dark brown cold peanut sauce which was amazing. My other two friends ordered pot stickers which they said were very good.   For entrees, my buddy had the Beef Brisket Pho and I had the shrimp with stir fried noodles. My friend said it was delicious, and the serving was a very generous bowl with chopsticks utensils. I don't really care for soupy dishes so the shrimp with stir friend noodles was perfect for me. Way too much for me but I took half of it home. This place has a very warm, comforting atmosphere and friendly staff. The prices are very reasonable, overall a great dinner for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef brisket pho

l8KwScZi3l6u1Gfb6bgpfg.text: I ordered a combination fried rice today and I don't know what happened with my to-go order but the shrimps did not get deveined and the food is overly salted. Char siu is burnt as well. Usually when I purchase my meals here at night its not this poorly made. Hopefully my next visit is much better.

BsWdKTAXiMEvzOxwSGTFMA.text: I've been here a number of times because it's literally walking distance from my house. The pho is always a good portion and the broth is on point. My regular is the rare beef and brisket. I never finish it and I swear the noodles expand and soak up the soup! The taro and pork egg rolls are bomb! A must get!  Of all the times Ive been here, it's always busy. This is my first time doing take out so I was able to observe. For a Monday night, it was exceptionally busy! The owner kept apologizing to everyone for how busy they were and  falling behind. I, myself waited almost an hour for my take out but that's okay. I totally understand! It's not like they were sitting around picking their ass. They were Hustling!   If you want good egg rolls and pho, definitely go to this place! Pricing is comparative to the other ones in town so that's not even a factor.

Which is why it was a huge shock to get home and open the lid to my broth and find this little guy floating on the surface.
