eeHF6UUc8uzbKNKvmK3LBg.text: First time eating here with a friend who's never had Pho before. We came after the rainy weather inspired hot and warm food that also happened to be near us. We found this place on yelp and drove 5 mins from Windmill to get here.   We were seated immediately and looked through the menu for abt 5mins. I ordered the P.16 (Well done Brisket and Flank Noodle soup) and my friend ordered the P.22 (Chicken Meat Noodle Soup in beef broth), with pork and taro vietnamese fried egg rolls to share. The portions are large and delicious. My friend has soup to take home and we devoured the egg rolls. Portions are huge for the price of less than $10 for soup. Service was great and they only brought the tab when they'd made sure I was completely done eating. Not into hot soup? They have rice and noodles without the soup as well as appetizers and the options to add spice to any of it. The only fault I found was that my cup of water was dirty and I'd only realized it at the end of my meal (having had 2-3 "top off" refills). That kinda grossed me out. All in all though...3 stars. Considering returning.

4pq-5UzuAhzrPRAo1csqtQ.text: This place is absolutely amazing! I only ordered one veggie pho and egg rolls! I told them I like all of the sauce and fixings and they basically served me a bring it home pho buffet! I highly recommend this restaurant!       Thanks again pho aimee!!!

Idc-V3BNzsG5kjl2AnqDvg.text: Wow wow wow.  Came here for the first time tonight & ordered the steak & meatball pho, egg rolls & a Thai iced tea.  When I tell you everything was perfect, that is not an exaggeration.  The pho broth is perfectly balanced with just the right amount of flavor to either eat as it is or customized.  The egg rolls were fresh, crunchy and incredibly delicious.  While some egg rolls tend to be single note, this one managed to be complex with texture and different discernible flavors.  The Thai iced tea wasn't syrupy or overly heavy, but achieved a perfect balance of creaminess and depth.  As somebody who considers themselves a discerning pho consumer, this has passed every taste test with flying colors.    In addition to the phenomenal flavors, the service is quick, polite and attentive and the interior of the restaurant is understated but cozy.    This may have to be my new spot and I'm glad to have found it.

Now we don't have to go all the way to chinatown to get our pho fix. The service is always great and their price is very reasonable as well.

qL3n3acvHlFP_PpvSNOvSw.text: Have you ever watched a show or a movie that you loved as a kid when you were older but realized how corny it was and couldn't understand why you liked it so much back then? That best describes my Pho Aimie experience.   I was introduced to their spicy chicken curry pho a few years ago and fell head over heels for the dish. So when I was planning my eats for my quick trip to Vegas, Pho Aimie made the cut.   Mom and I went there on a Sunday afternoon and she ordered the same dish but with rice and I ordered it pho style. I was highly disappointed as the dish did not bring back any nostalgia feels and I was left puzzled wondering what I loved about this dish back in the day.   The broth lacked that rich consoling flavor which was either from no seasoning or too much oil. Not the most disgusting thing I've had, but it was not even close to a-ok. It also had way too many onions and that just added to the treachery.  The service was better than the food but that's usually at every pho place. They're pretty attentive and get your food out quick.   Sorry not sorry but next visit to Vegas, Pho Aimee is not on the list.

4W2fGNsvNQeu5RdqBHxfpQ.text: Well I just love eating Pho, so instead of always heading to Chinatown for Pho I decided to give this neighborhood Pho place a try. I walked in and everyone was very friendly, I indeed felt welcomed which is always nice when going into any restaurant let alone a neighborhood spot. Sat down got our orders and everything seemed ok until once the food came the service stopped. My friend and no water for the longest time, plus I kept piling dishes that were dirty and no longer needed in the front of the table hoping the next person that walk by would pick them up but they stayed on the table the entire time. My friend had to call for someone to bring her water. And I had to ask someone to please clear the dirty plates that were sitting on the table. Maybe their policy is get them in, get them fed and get them outside with no service in between. It's a shame too because I liked how friendly they were and the food was good. The potstickers were really good. I gave 2 stars due to how friendly they were and the potstickers were good. This place has potential if the service was better. Without good service it makes going out to eat meaningless.

vLqeq5jbpF08fXD076Cezg.text: pho here is the best on the southwest side of town. ive been to many pho places around town this one is definitely my favorite. the bowls here are big but i eat alot so i actually ask for extra noodles. ive had the potstickers, chicken wings, egg rolls, spring rolls, pad thai. porkchop and rice, egg wrapped fried rice, rice vermicelli bowls and obviously the pho. the pho is my favorite here followed by the fried rice. my only complaint is the checking out service is super slow. when its somewhat busy it takes the server a little while to get me my check. but other than that i definitely choose this place over jennipho. that place is no good and they dont take card. thats a demerit in my book.

ZLpWvJWJJO77QzutuWdcSw.text: No, no, no. I've tried Pho Annie twice already and the only reason I went the second time? Was because I was too congested the first time to actually taste my food. You can really taste the sugar in the broth and no matter how much Siracha or other sauces I added to my Pho Dac Biet, I couldn't get rid of the sweet.   The service however is fast and the staff there is pretty pleasant. I just honestly wouldn't go there to eat any of the Pho... which honestly then makes it a moot point for me. Why would I go to a place that has "Pho" in the title and not eat the Pho? Hard pass on this place.

2B6VzA-uuH3aKrng9cSWVQ.text: Recent Visit March 10, 2015  Food - 5/5 Service - 5/5 Cleanliness - 5/5  Overall - 5/5  One of my personal favorite Pho locations in town. Very convenient locations for the southwest.  The quality of the food, portion size and price are well worth the value and visit. The restaurant is very friendly as the owner is very hands off and provides great service along with her staff.   --------------------------------------------Food - 5/5--------------------------------------------------- The food is very consistent and well prepared and made. The menu is well designed and covers most of the essential Vietnamese dishes. A few of my favorites include;  Pho Tai / Pho Tai Sach - Traditional beef pho (I prefer mine with tripe). The broth is very well seasoned and packs a ton of flavor. According to Ann, they do not use MSG. Hard to say that about other Vietnamese places.  Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio- The rice vermacilli noodles with grilled pork and egg rolls is another one of my favorites. This is one of my to-go dish because its quick and simple to grab on my way home. Plus the portion size is quite big and I can easily get fulfilled.  Rice with Pork chop and baked egg- Another one of my favorite dishes to get at the restaurant or to-go. This comes with 2 large porkchop, baked egg, lettuce, tomatoes, and picked radishes. Very fullfilling meal and the portion sizes can be quite filling for one person.  ----------------------------------------------Service 5/5------------------------------------------------- Services is the best thing about this place. Ann is very hands on with her business and is very professional and courteous to every customer. She treats everyone like friends and family which is my favorite type of service. It is very genuine and makes it my favorite pho location in town not just because I believe it has one of the better Pho but the service is one of the best. --------------------------------------------Cleanliness - 5/5--------------------------------------------- Front of house is clean and the open kitchen looks well maintained as well. One of the harder parts in a restaurant is a visible kitchen and Pho Annie has no problem allowing the customers to see the kitchen.  Overall, one of my favorite Pho locations in town. Great food, affordable price and great services makes a great experience. Very good locations to go for lunch, dinner or for grabbing a to-go order.

n_BbTMHpvN1d5QsbjvqRbw.text: After being sold to the new owner Pho Annie has gone down hill. Every time I go to pho annie I'd get the "com tam xuon". Ever since they sold it the food has just gone to trash. The rice was soggy, the cha was mushy and had no taste and it was oddly colored.. The xuon was alright but not good. They went cheap on the fish sauce too. It used to be given in a big cup but now the size shrunk so I end up eating plain and soggy rice. Before they'd give 2 pieces of xuon, cha was outstanding, and even a side of eggs. Don't even get me started on the soup that goes with the order. It was sour I don't know if it was because all of the onions that was in it or the broth is old. Never coming back again.

L7_pzCuracs_VUdODHfNmQ.text: The pho was amazing!! The atmosphere was great. I very much enjoyed our server and all the staff, they were super friendly and very welcoming!!

elfBOZJFQCaeCRuYHsPDgg.text: I love everything about this place. The service is great, the food is amazing. Plus, the food come out really fast too, so if you are hungry to death, go to this place. I love this place so much, and I'm being really honest here cause I don't know how to lie. (I'm not advertising here.)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Thai ice tea here is not too sweet, which is perfect.

_q8qLHyIG0tCm-ZIOIK9Fw.text: Verdict: Decent pho and other Viet dishes, but service is hit-AND-miss.   I really wanted to like this place. I really did. But I can't get over the fact that I just tried to call-in my order and they put me on hold for over 10 minutes without saying anything to me! I hung up the phone after that and tried to call back, but then the line was busy. Just wow.   As for the food, it's not bad. Good flavor, everything is seasoned well and cooked to order. Freshly washed veggies, piping hot broths and tender cuts of meat help to maintain a 3-star rating in my opinion.   I only return here for the convenience factor, but other than that--you're better off getting your "Pho Fix" in the outskirts of Chinatown.   Until next time: Eat on, Yelpers.

5QnGnhrTmPB1Z3KzH9qQTQ.text: By far the best pho restaurant I've been to in Vegas. Recommend the spring rolls and curry pho. But everything here is amazing and authentic With great flavor and great service. A must visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8VIuBQsm33MXbWlx0cz5JA.text: I have been searching for great pho since i moved here 3 years ago, and i am happy to say i finally found it! Portions are great, broth is awesome, and prices are very reasonable. I also love the spring rolls here and their peanut sauce is perfect! I stopped eating pho for way too long because i was disappointed and let down with the local places, but pho aimie does it right!! Its authentic and delicious!

dttYfTGyhNeX3depwWq35A.text: Located on the SW side of town, on Rainbow, near Windmill. Not really a place you'd go to normally unless you live in the area.   Small little restaurant, owned by Vietnamese-Chinese owners.  Was told this place was decent, as was also told that their portions are the "largest" in the city.   Came here for lunch on a saturday afternoon. Friend was there waiting already but after i arrived, waiter came up and took our order. Didn't take too long for the food to come out.   She had ordered a rare beef & tendon pho (#18?) and i ordered the combination pho (#12?)  Combination pho - $7.99? - various types of sliced beef, two slivers of beef balls (yeah slivers.. imagine a beef ball... and cut into.... 1/8th's...), and a piece of tendon. Meat and noodle amount wasn't bad. To me, seemed a LITTLE more than the usual from like Pho Saigon 8 or Pho So 1, but those two definitely didn't have meat balls in their combination pho's. The broth, not exactly msg free. Reason i say that is, if it was a real made broth, you usually dont feel like you have phlegm in your throat, causing you to do the *eh-hem* kind things to "clear" it. Wasn't a soup i'd drink completely like some other places.   Rare beef & Tendon Pho - $6.99? - this wasn't my order but from what my friend said, she didn't get that many pieces of tendon (disappointing for her since she loves eating tendon). And to her, it didn't seem like much of a size difference compared to other places.   NOTE - minimum credit card charge is $10.   Overall, not a bad place, if you are in the area. I'd probably pick this place over the other place down the street (Jenni Pho)

fnODBXeqogjZ1J9tfUjm0Q.text: This review is for months sgo.tasted  awful not the same and saw all new people working and they had no clue. Found out annie had sold it. Under annie it ran like a well oile d  machine  and the food was much better. Will never go back.

MvRYCOK84HRcjOZ03Dsa7w.text: Tell me why I've never heard of "Pho Sate" until I came here?! I came in the other day expecting to order my usual rare steak pho but was wanting to try something new. I told the waitress (who I'm pretty sure was Annie herself) that I like the broth of bun bo hue but not all that crap in it. She quickly suggested the special, Pho Sate, and oh man .. it was life changing! A delicious spicy and sour beef broth with pho noodles and flank. All these years of sirracha drenched pho .. only wish I knew about it sooner.    The spot is nice a clean, and the staff is usually friendly and attentive. I've tried their appetizers and rice plates as well. Good food all around!

sKcEFFx4reZXlRtG9WC1iQ.text: Small, cute, dim restaurant. Spring rolls were excellent and healthy and refreshing. One friend ordered Shrimp Pad Thai-looked amazing. Three of us ordered Pho-Seafood Pho, Special Pho with duck and beef, etc., and I ordered Chicken Curry Pho, which really wasn't all that spicy. I didn't particularly like the chicken part, felt it was a little too tough, but the broth part and noodle part of my pho were good. Also ordered Vietnamese Iced Coffee, which was excellent.   My fave parts were the spring rolls and the iced coffee. Would also recommend seafood pho and pad Thai based on its looks and its lovely scents. Cute Asian inspired decor throughout, such as the lucky cat, bamboo......Service was prompt and friendly.

_k3JjtQH4-ccN0hvjGS_bg.text: Just give a 2 star because it seem like one of the server don't want to work after 9:25 pm I guess... Anyways I usually prefer to go pho annie over Jenni pho even though jenni pho is much closer from my place but I guess not anymore... WzZwR5L23vLu60Cx3_o-Pw.text: I picked up pho here on my way home yesterday. I called ahead and the guy on the phone was nice enough and got my order on the first try, which is rare for phone orders with the language barrier. LOL. He said it would be ready in 5 minutes and luckily I was just 5 minutes away. They were a bit skimpy on the meat and tendon, but DAMN that is one good bowl of pho. I ALWAYS have to drench my broth in fish sauce, but I didn't have any on hand and realized I had forgotten to ask for a side. But thankfully the broth was perfect just the way it came, and I only needed to add some sriracha. I daresay this is the best bowl of pho I've ever had. I will be coming back to dine in and check out this horrible service I keep hearing about...Hopefully it's just a myth from some picky yelpers. ;) oh yeah, and other food items!

HQTWgEBq-vTkj1rj_RgnPQ.text: Just ok pho... make sure not to confuse with another similar name on spring mountain....  best thing was veggies...

Q-2PVoO3DHnMSaHTLFn_qg.text: Fresh quality ingredients. Quick service when I called in my order ahead. Staff very friends.

pKJNox20_GuTgLMzZ6YJOA.text: I just found my new favorite pho spot! The broth was so delicious I had to keep stopping myself from consuming it all before I finished my noodles. This is the best place I've eaten at since coming to vegas. Part of me wants to share this place with the world, but the rest of me wants to keep it to myself.

x6K-Oiz9-wxFPd0UvJb6SQ.text: Delicious! I was pleasantly surprised by their veggie pho. I am vegan and I don't like tofu but they were great and added extra veggies!  Also I asked for no extra salt because pho is usually already salty and it came with no salt. I loved it sodium is a killer for me.

UKdU1TwXGxKKP-NdLKlrsw.text: I absolutely love this place, ever since my Bestfriend took me here to eat. It's so convenient and close to home. I always get regular rare steak pho, I also get extra limes and my meat on the side. The best part is they don't give me a hard time about it. Most places I've eaten at usually do or charge me extra for the meat to be on the side. I always get good service here too. It's also very affordable i recommend this place. Best pho place on this side of town by far.

OcLOqpV11l6KvHboxO5mbg.text: The pho broth is actually flavorful and doesn't just taste like hot water with beef and noodles. I usually do take out and the order comes out fast during dinner which should be expected with pho, it's not hard to soak noodles, slice beef and pour broth.

MS1pxCP09xav6VIHo90mJg.text: My husband and I love Pho Annie and have been going there for 2 years now! Imagine our pleasant surprise when they opened a new location (Pho Annie 2) in the SW part of town! :) What we most appreciate about the restaurants are their friendly staff.

Ld0v8_UfbEp-zGnoBdzj7A.text: FINALLY found a pho place near me so that I don't have to drive down to Chinatown.  I came in with my bf for lunch on a Saturday and the place was packed. First thing I noticed was that all the customers were regulars (good sign!). This lady (assuming is Annie), went around and chatted with all the customers like they were family. +1 to service. I ordered the pho dac biet and the bf ordered the beef noodle soup. I really enjoyed the broth for mine but as Andrew C. mentioned, it was probably laced with msg. My inner Chinese could just tell but thankfully I'm used to msg. The amount of noodle was good however it was lacking in some of the meat and tripe. I really like tripe =( and there was literally 1 beef ball... it was cut in half. Not a very tasty beef ball might I add. We also ordered a side of fried egg rolls. They were fried well however I didn't like the filling.. the bf however loved it. So if you're ever in the area and want pho or if you're just deciding between Jennipho or Pho Annie, ALWAYS PICK PHO ANNIE.

TxE1punAQhwLBb722NRzyw.text: I did a heads up comparison with the pho joint down the road who was on Rainbow first. No comparison, Annie Pho's rare beef and tendon is superior in all ways. The beef is more tender, the pieces of tendon are huge and cooked perfectly, the noodles are not mushy, and the broth is incredibly flavorful. I'm not into food contests but should the meal request indicate pho, this is where my body will go.

YbHrumkMMWI-KHScDs0pHA.text: I have actually come back a few times since they are convenient. The pho is really pretty good. I'm still looking for the best in Vegas so any pointers would be great.

IWXqKbuZBOVr7cj8GqH-pQ.text: I come here every couple of weeks and I've never had a bad time. They are fast, affordable, and friendly. I always get pho tai and I always love it. Great for the hangover.

PW9cqOmVTQYS6uQsgGOuJA.text: Go here. Get the roasted duck pho and spring rolls...so amazing! If you get something else be sure to talk about the spiciness levels...they can cool the pho down with more plain broth, but the chicken curry pho (while delicious) was extremely spicy. The pot stickers (steamed) were great as well. I would have given 5 stars but the decor needs a little revamp...if I were rating food alone it would easily be 5 stars. Also, the portions are big...great value! Yummy.

2ACtQsgHvrW9otwkeSB4OA.text: The food is always excellent.  They are great with special requests and minor changes to the order due to allergies.  The egg rolls are amazing and made by hand daily.

UX_dyyD1GQVI2z7d6VfmMA.text: I am pleased to see Pho places creeping West.  I do not like to drive all the way to Chinatown whenever I have a hot soup craving.    Pho Annie is cute inside.  Clean.   Pho, egg rolls, and iced coffee were A-OK.  Nothing better or worse than your average Pho place aside from the slighty nicer ambiance.  Service was short,  and generic as expected.  I'd go back anytime to warm my belly and soul with hot soup.

uLyVADcN2JkNzM49OPhbiw.text: Favorite pho place from now on. Only place that has satay noodle and it's sooooo good.

h_KxiN2BuIfaug4PYvM1Qg.text: The waiters were friendly; however, the food was really lacking. It was either overly salty or really under salted and plain, not much favoring. Overall, we ordered 4 different dishes and all the favoring was not on point. On a positive note though, there were a lot of food on each dish; they just didn't taste great. I wouldn't recommend this place to those who are visiting Las Vegas and are looking for a Vietnamese restaurant to eat at.

iCQ_1OMOgRCm7n-cs5b_nA.text: The pho is here top notch. Very quick and convenient. Definitely worth checking out. If you're reallllly hungry try the dumplings.

yZwaWn5UgGrr1JWxHGknZw.text: My go to place for pho in Vegas. Small place but they do it right. I get the BBQ pork pho with won tons and add a squirt of hot and Duck sauce. Perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ pork pho  mmmmm

30zggHJYxAnhzrlH2JdiHg.text: I have eaten here many times.  The employees over there really give absolutely superb service every time.  They happily answer any questions I have and are always super nice.  I was talking to the owner and he is a heck of a guy also.  I will continue going there

KSLNL08qt4GdBiWd9d6MAw.text: This place is great.  True to the bone of Vietnamese cuisine.  Great fresh spring rolls, great vermicelli, and egg noodles, & great Pho (Rare steak & Brisket).  I'm hungry now.  I'm heading over!

x4-WVN1-oJ6mjK9-2OKAOQ.text: Veggie pho is vegan, gluten-free, and includes broccoli, bok choy, carrots, black mushrooms, green onion.  No msg.  The veggie broth is very plain, though.

-hMuNPKs6_s8NhUFR49zTQ.text: This is my new favorite pho place that's not on Spring Mountain.   I'd give more stars, but my first server treated me like a gringo, and you can't order a 1/2 order of spring rolls.   They actually messed up my order at first(I'm not gonna complain because they gave me too much tendon), but they fixed it perfectly. I almost didn't have to add fish sauce to my broth, because it was so well seasoned. Easily the best pho in Mountains Edge.

6j7HPWRl3yFCt7Ma66bYrw.text: I was a bit skeptical of coming to a Vietnamese restaurant in the southwest away from some of my favorite places in chinatown, but my friend convinced me to try Pho Annie...and I'm glad that I did. This is definitely a hidden gem in the southwest area of town when you do not want to drive over to Spring Mountain/Chinatown.   I had the Pho Dac Biet (basically the pho with everything) and it was a good sized portion and very flavorful. There was a good amount of meat and noodles and definitely enough to fill up most appetites. We also got the egg rolls which come as 4 eggrolls with lettuce to wrap. They were also quite good.  I am looking forward to going back to Pho Annie to try some of the rice and dry noodle dishes that other reviewers have talked about.

Dp7SD-mIUAYPXXQ1lu6nPQ.text: Definitely coming back.   Phantasy hair salon recommended this spot and I have to say. It's pretty good.   Being from LA, around the SGV we are surround by the best pho in the the world!!! So whenever I travel to other cities, states, country-- I try their pho. I have to say Pho Annie lives up to SGV standards and is definitely the best pho in Vegas IMO. Plus I don't have to deal with going to Vegas Chinatown.   Definitely try Pho Annie's special pho and ask for the spicy broth (if you like spice). And you can't go wrong with the mango salad (effin good!) and the egg wrapped fried rice!   The place is small but very clean and the service is VERY FRIENDLY! Absolutely better service than the pho spots in LA. lol

xNRgaoFDwF-K0Il2HBUC9g.text: The service was great. Menue was good. They gave me more pot stickers then the menu said. How ever my pho wasn't hot. It was more warm and if your sick you want hot pho. I also felt discriminated cause I'm white and the dude just gave me a fork and I had to ask for chop sticks. Not the worst but I feel there better pho out there

JAxMb6daKuWEsM2thEuGgw.text: The pho broth is delicious. I also ordered their mackerel and chicken wings ... tasty. The service was attentive and fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings and the mackerel rice plate. Yum!

UnVhbyvkYXJA5-W6qDjQ9g.text: I frequent pho Annie at least twice a month. Today, to my surprise channel 13 dirty dining showed up. It's not difficult to keep a clean kitchen and not get placed on the list. Maybe if the owner spent more money cleaning their cesspool of a kitchen and keeping their food properly stored, instead of on a new Porsche this wouldn't happen. Completely unacceptable and will never return.

ulIFPKnzLBodKH2L_fIU2g.text: Generous portions at a fair price. The Pho Tai soup and the Pad Thai noodle dishes were excellent.  Wish I lived nearby.

jRZgPCFRt151_EZNTwQ0SQ.text: Pho Annie is delish!!! I still love pho Kim long but it's pretty far from my house.. I always get the veggie pho and my bf gets rare beef. We've tried a few different apps and dishes and liked them all; spring rolls, egg rolls, calamari, chicken wings and combo fried rice. The only dish I wasn't a huge fan of was the crispy noodles with seafood; I didn't love the noodles and there wasn't much seafood in the mix.. regardless their pho is solid and their service is outstanding!

Tsyk_xPXrk6y7K4kyUkDng.text: Just because a place isn't in China Town, doesn't mean it can't be as good as them. Such a cute little place with the best fried rice ever. It's wrapped in a giant scrambled egg. I also had this type of dry noodle dish with bbq and shrimp in it. Definitely plan to keep going here on rainy days.

6mpbJectcGZmykDZM-1FCQ.text: I love Pho Annie! It's very close to where I live. There's plenty of parking, it's in a nice and chill plaza.  I love their spring rolls, vegetable pho, calamari, and Thai iced tea! I always get take out pho here, ordering on the phone ahead of time, usually takes them 10-15 minutes.  I never had to wait a long time for my order.  The people that work here know what they're doing!  Whenever I do eat inside, whenever I want more broth they always give me more with no problem or charge.  I love it.  Sometimes at other pho restaurants the broth is kind of oily which makes my stomach churb, but Pho Annie's pho isn't like that, it is always on point! I would go to this pho restaurant before going all the way to Chinatown for pho.  It's just as good, probably even better than most pho places on Spring Mountain.

Mi_qHterM0ZvMV5dalhK8Q.text: Love this place. The price is great for the quality of food! They'll even make you something off menu if you tell them your taste preference!

LYfK7pfLIS72qTjNbJYMew.text: The Food here are great besides there great service. Most of the time I do go, they are friendly and very attentive to most customers. I see that they all work hard to make the best pho in Vegas you can enjoy and other dishes and spring rolls was always prepared well. Great job to the team and do know that there are customers who appreciate you and what you serve because everyone put there effort into it. At least I can go there as well and eat comfortably.

Hy02oSn-Jcw2V882DqdMew.text: I went in for my usual pho until I saw a customer order a unique looking dish. It looked like a bird nest but it was tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t be afraid! It looks like a bird nest but the crunchy noodles with vegetables is pretty tasty.

o1y-nyV8NLR8YOfo6tKmZg.text: Bleh. That's all I can really say about this place. The food is sub par. The service is horrible. The only upside? It's close to me.   We got seated, and ordered two waters and one hot tea. We received one water and one hot tea. When the waiter came to take our order, I once again asked for another water. When they came to deliver the dipping sauces for the egg rolls, which was about five minutes later, I once again asked for another water. When they delivered our egg rolls, about ten minutes later - I once again asked for another water. When they delivered our main course, about a minute and a half later - I once again asked for a water. FIVE TIMES. Five times of asking to get a simple glass of water. Seriously? That's so ridiculous.   Also, the fact that our appetizer came out only a minute and a half before our entree, is ridiculous to me. That's not quite the point of an appetizer - but ok. They were decent in taste. The pho was alright. Broth was very oily and not too hot. Flavor was there though.   All in all, no thanks Pho Annie. No thanks.

3oBIlTVdz5iaZnfXfr6tPQ.text: It was just OK. The pho was alright, but less beef than other places. The appetizers were a little disappointing. The fried squid was very soggy. Pot stickers were good.   The service was good, but they seemed a little understaffed. The lady who seated us was waiting most of the tables as well.

j31lV7Bfwahg9ZlgT_G31Q.text: The Roasted duck  noodle soup is delicious ! I love it. The pho noodles are not soggy and the meals always come out fresh and hot. The bathrooms are very clan and the staff is always friendly and nice :)

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The roast duck noodle soup :)

G20T5wOPuR8gHl6QeJ3M7w.text: I am definitely a fan!   Pho Annie is located literally right next to Cheeburger Cheeburger off of Rainbow Blvd just south of Windmill Drive.   The place is pretty small and a bit older, but was still almost totally filled with diners when we arrived earlier this afternoon. At first, we were a bit taken back because one of the first things we saw upon entering was a server "aggressively" bussing a table. We just looked at each other like "ok", this could be interesting.  Actually, this ended up being a great experience! My friend was craving some pho and ordered the #10, the Annie Special ($9.95), which included beef, meatballs, tripe, and plenty of noodles. He commented that this pho was much better than the pho we had at Jenni pho just a few days ago. Looks like with the cooler weather here, I will be grabbing a bowl of pho here on my next visit!  As for me, I opted for the #40 ($9.95). This consisted of a tender, marinated pork chop that was unbelievably tasty! On the side was a small "salad", a healthy portion of jasmine rice with a fried egg on top, and some cucumber slices. Great choice for my first visit here!  The service was actually solid here as well. The server was quick to top off our beverages without a word and checked in on us a couple of times to see how things were going, but not to the point of being intrusive.  I was greatly impressed and, since it is a stones throw from my new house, I will be back to try more and more menu items! I can easily see this becoming a regular spot!  4 solid stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

L7tBqegrKiNvecZICLiJ-A.text: My family and I used to enjoy dining here, especially for the garlicky butter chicken wings. Sadly, one experience has turned us off completely from eating here ever again. While waiting for our food to arrive I noticed that one of the employees/managers/owner(?) was clipping her toe nails at a booth a couple tables down. Not only that but she never went to at least wash her hands before serving other tables their food. The whole experience completely grossed us out and can never return.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2xUgSR4o1BJksnGI6n7Rzw.text: O. M. G. What the eff happened?  This was my go-to spot  traveling over the last 3 years.  The place used to be packed,  now it's empty.   The pho is BLAND and used to be full of flavor.   The spring rolls was basic.   Left over lettuce, old shrimp.   The upbeat, energetic, friendly staff is now replaced with people who tolerate you.  It wasn't hostile,  but..... different...I wanted to leave.  The energy is gone.   Very disappointing.

a3YUo53IzLxEZ9__RQ80wQ.text: I was a little put off at first that the older gentleman didn't greet us or ask for our drink order when we first got there. He kind of just put our table together when we got there and ran to the back. Then the next guest that comes through the door and they receive the correct service from the younger server. Going to so many Asian restaurants, I should be used to this, but the difference between the two bothered me. Why is there never consistency?   However, all that changed once the younger server ended up taking care of us. I ordered the standard pho because they ran out of the chicken curry pho. We also ordered the duck pho and the fried eggrolls, both great. The only reason I will come back is for the service and to try that chicken curry pho finally. I also like how they take credit cards unlike Jenny Pho. It's just nice that I don't have to travel all the way to Chinatown for pho anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck Pho

BB-WqbCHs1SqZnbUT4jT7g.text: This place is absolutely delicious! Totally recommend! Been here like 5 times and always good.

bOi11kUYwyQNzlbLHMYahA.text: This was our last spot before heading back to the airport. We drove about 30 mins to get here and I was expecting something amazing because of the high reviews. Yelp you failed me! Our server was very friendly, but she took forever to get our orders.   We both ordered the PHO DAC BIET and it was nothing special. The broth wasn't flavorful and tasted bland. The meat was chewy and didn't taste fresh. Did I get bad luck and go on the wrong day? It can't be that everyone was wrong. Nevertheless, I won't be coming back to try my luck again. I'm sure there are other pho restaurants that can be more consistent and more flavorful.

f350vv0YjDjXpYz2hGK5rQ.text: The service here is phenomenal! They know me by name and help me with my bags to the car when I order takeout. I can't wait for the cold weather so we can start coming here more often again. It's just so consistent both the food and the service I wouldn't go to another pho restaurant unless it was after hours. By far my favorite. Hands-down! I appreciate all you do here!

Sgezb80sEjoK0kQRzfKwsw.text: Really loved the food it was savory and homestyle. Me and my girlfriend loved  our lunch time choice to drive across town, from rainbow and 95. Springrolls here are great it actually has pork in it along staying traditional. Also the portions here are very generous. Our food came out extremely fast!       Customer service was spot on, very friendly and fast. Our server Steven answered all the questions and was happy to acustom any modifications you might want to a reasonabke extent ofcourse. Surely we will revisit soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The authenticity of this place is wonderful! Not too americanized just the way we like it.

_q78VRgm24AxW_HXNSRuCg.text: I love pho. I love eating it during the hot summer days. I love eating it on the cold winter evening. What I don't love is walking into a restaurant, being sat, ignored and watching other tables who have been seated after me being served before anyone had even approached my table.  Yes this place used to be awesome. Service was prompt, food was excellent but the last few times I've come here things definitely were not the same. Servers seem flustered when it's busy, side items like basil or jalapenos were forgotten, getting the check takes forever, payment takes forever and the food just seems meh now.   Perhaps I will come back in a few months and see if things have improved or if they are the same...

-iPmzMIXwYwQDyE4QrDQZQ.text: Checked out this pho restaurant during a recent trip to Vegas. My entire family agreed that it was the best pho off the strip that we've had! Great portions too! My husband frequently comes to Vegas for work and he said that this place will now be his new go-to pho spot!

mBjeb1S2LArooeXqDbaTNw.text: Had dinner there last night, white meat chicken pho, no noodles, extra vegetables. The broth had a rich flavorful taste. I feel like they spend a lot of time making it. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Great family owned small business, I'll definitely be back.

V7FknkhQW55W4N5olSSoIw.text: My fiancee and I live down the street from this place, and we would always come here when it was "Pho Annie". Dined here a week ago, (now "Pho Aimie"), and the food was disgusting.   Service was great, always refilled our waters and were very attentive, but for whatever reason, the pho was very lackluster. I drowned my soup in soy sauce and hoisen to try to get some kind of flavor, and it did nothing. The "vegetables" in my vegetable pho consisted of 95% broccoli, 2 pieces of bok choy, 1 carrot slice, 2 slices of tofu, and although I requested extra onion, barely any onion. The broth was downright gross for both of us. (I had vegetable broth, he had beef broth)  Whomever the new owners are, you need to step up your game. A lot. We are currently looking for a new pho spot. Likely won't return.

2Ld7_9UXxd09t-JAdoReBw.text: I really like Pho Annie. Been here twice in a matter of a month....and so far, so good. Clean tables and booths. Utensils, plates and bowls are cleaned too. Free from any remains of food or gunk stuck like how other Asian/pho places in Chinatown.  Boyfriend and I always order the spring rolls to start off with. I order the Pho Tai (rare beef steak) and he orders the Well Done Flank. Each bowl was about $7.95. Pretty good sized portion too. Our orders always come super quick....like within 3 minutes!!! Even quicker during early dinner time. Wow! I'm loving that!  The one thing that stands out with Pho Annie versus other pho places I've tried is their broth contains no MSG. It's not as salty. Broth is still fantastic and drenching it in Sirracha sauce is even better!!!!! Yumm!!! This is PERFECT on a cold, winters day!!  We met the owner too, Annie. Such a sweet lady. Very friendly and personable. Even though it was super busy that day, she still stopped by and had a chat with us.

MBwZ354vcfMMNrh3Ru4aoA.text: BBQ pork dish that comes with eggs and rice- 5 star SUPER LEGIT.  It was perfectly marinated, and hit the spot.   Pad See Ew- 2 star. The flavor wasn't right, I mean, why Thai food in a vietnamese restaurant right? Shoulda known better.   Chicken wings- 3 star. Went down a bit, because it wasn't as good as the first time I tried it.   I will be back for the pork dish.

rIzJawaYPvbUYibJ-82l-A.text: My first visit. Got an order (rare beef pho) to go. Service was quick. Food was good. Quantity was good. Will go back and try other food.

BrSp2pQBxBm5oOaXD6YClw.text: When you are in Vegas forget steak and eggs, you have to try the Pork Chop and eggs!  Served over rice with fish sauce as a side option this is such a great deal.  If you want some Pho noodles, you will not t be disappointed. The soup base is great and the price is just $8.  Highly recommend and better than any vietnamese restaurants i normally eat at in los angeles.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Chop and Eggs!  Best I ever had!

5-jv07VHQ4FJvnaC3GQ7Vg.text: I get the same Pho every time I come here and even with new owners it was same; quick, friendly service with delicious Pho. Comes with same amount of sides, broth, meat, etc. I got my meal to-go and my meat was completely frozen. Luckily it goes in boiling hot broth to defrost. I'll continue to come here because I haven't been disappointed.

-IbPWooHEvcB7dwzVgSVoA.text: I used to take my family and friends from out of town (usually California) to Pho Annie on a regular basis (like from 2012 to 2016). During the early days, my best friend and I would get pissed off waiting on food, but then when it finally came (I typically got pho dac biet and she got the pork and egg roll bun), the food would be so amazing and we'd be like, "Well the wait was totally worth it!"  Fast forward a few years of amazing food, and friendly service (we love Annie btw... such a nice and hard-working owner)... we had a friend come from Santa Monica, CA with their 3 year old daughter. They were staying at our place and we decided to go out for a celebratory dinner. I had my usual, pho dac biet, and everyone got egg rolls and chicken fried rice.  Something was wrong with the fried rice because when we got home, everyone except me threw up. I was so sad, because #1 I love Annie, #2 this place was my go-to place for family and friend events. I had to post this because I want people to be safe and I want Pho Annie to get better, back to where it was when I came to eat at least twice a week. I heard ownership changed, so please make it as good as it was before, with fresh meat, bouncy noodles, and sophisticated light broth.  I want to come back and give this place more stars.

bidPqlGXVAd-xs46MU_kgw.text: We got Pho to go. It was excellent and hit the spot. The dining room also looked nice. Maybe we will stay next time.

FyaWB_FttQRvFVJbF6fVdg.text: We just left and seriously had the worst service ever. We are a party of 7, so they said 10-15 minute wait, which of course we were totally fine with. Then after 10-15 mins another guy asks us if we're waiting, and we tell him the same. He says wait another 10-15 mins. Too much confusion and no communication. Finally, we're seated separately (as their restaurant doesn't accommodate parties this big). Then after waiting quite long for someone to take our order, we notice one of the guys taking orders from another table that arrived WAY after us, and then he still never came to us. I've ordered beef stew from here to go previously, which was pretty good. But this experience was poor as f***!   Updated 1/15/17 I should've mentioned it actually wasn't that busy on this specific evening, and I've gone to many restaurants with the expectation to wait (of course with a bigger party especially), however, I did state we noticed other tables having their orders taken BEFORE us, after they arrived and were even seated AFTER us. I personally don't think there is any excuse for that.

lVW_F1NxpiQ6YWbgOp2WHA.text: This place is truly a hidden gem. Well, I guess I really can't call it "hidden"- it was relatively busy the last time I was here. But it is hands down my favorite local Vietnamese joint. The thing I love must about this place is it's 'mom and pop' vibe. You can tell it's just a small family owned business the minute you walk into the restaurant.   1) Service: the waiter is super attentive. They come every few minutes to refill our water. The manager checked on us every time we were there to make sure we were satisfied with our meal. The service is extremely fast and efficient but they also take the time to smile and exchange pleasantries.   2) Food: the real deal!! 3 things you must order there: (1) BBQ pork chop rice with egg (2) BBQ pork vermicelli with egg roll (3) the beef noddle soup. The best thing about this place is they don't over salt their food. Their noodle soup is perfect- flavorful but not drenched in MSG. The BBQ pork is grilled to perfection. It's my husband's favorite item on the menu. He can't get enough! We haven't tried their pho, but it's on our to do list!   3) Atmosphere: on the outside, it looks like a lodge so it's easy to mistaken it for a bar. On the inside, its a small little restaurant  with some big flavors! The place is clean and well renovated.   4) Quality: delicious food, large portions, and cheap prices. What more can you ask for?? Most plates range from $8-12.   Definitely my favorite Vietnamese place! Trust me, you'll love it. Best local hot spot in the southwest.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun rieu (crab noodle soup)! Best in all of Vegas!
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ pork chop with egg! YAAAASSSS!!

L1iJUxPvKu4AWNx1lEz5Kw.text: This place is incredibly bad. I wouldn't recommend going here you are probably better off going to Pho Saigon 8 or even Dairy Queen or McDonalds.

0ugPN0W4NVno7fu4_QgnLw.text: This is hands-down my favorite pho joint in Las Vegas. I eat here at least once a week and it's because their broth is the best that I've found in town. Some pho broths just taste like salty beef water - Pho Aimie's is richer and more flavorful. Soup portions are beyond generous for what you pay. I'd love to keep this place a secret, but they've built up quite a regular crowd and this place can get super busy with tables and to-go orders on any given night - it's worth the wait! This is my permanent spot for pho in this city and I definitely recommend it.

XZ9XHUW68IthGXohZF2aPQ.text: Their pho is good but since I go to so many different places for pho, I can tell the difference with theirs. I ordered pho tai, the usual and my friend ordered the same thing but with tripe. We noticed that the broth was a little thicker, not too much thicker but I can definitely notice it. The biggest thing that threw me off is how oily it is! It has that oily aftertaste and it was just different. We didn't like it at all but the meat was good and it was just overall "ok". I'd go to other places for pho if I'm craving it though. Not a place I'd want to come back to!

OyvR0Wblm_5a1q8I8RRY6Q.text: Outstanding! Try the duck pho with the egg noodles with wontons. Tried a different noodle dish with a yellow curry and shrimp. Quite good . Update: new owners but food and service excellent!!!

bK4l2cnN80U0Srpq-lAy3A.text: I'm an idiot when it comes to pho. I really don't know the difference between one place or another. Broth, noodles, and meat. Got it. So this review isn't the most informative in terms of the taste of the pho. I ordered the Special Annie Pho. It was tasty, as is the pho at most places. The portion size was solid for the price.  I will say the service was excellent. It was a packed house on a Friday night and the food came out quickly. I went here with my aunt, uncle and cousin from out of town and they wanted to take typical Filipino family vacation group photos with their food. It would've been easy for the servers to shrug us off because it's a packed house, but they were accommodating and took some pictures for us on my cousin's iPad.  Another superficial perk is that they have a TV on the back wall playing the ESPN NBA game of the night. While they could've been playing some Vietnamese movie or blasting Vietnamese pop music (both of which do me no good), they instead play my favorite sport. Steph Curry from way downtown.... BANG!!

B15IXAbfaQZRtNIvHlh24g.text: I live on the southwest side of town so driving to Chinatown isn't always practical even though that's where most of the best pho places are.  I tried a few pho places in the southwest area and they just weren't that good.  I decided to stop in and try Pho Aimie for the first time and I'm glad I did..  The food was hot, good, plentiful, cooked just right, and I really enjoyed the meal and appetizer.  Patrick my server was awesome and really on top of things even though they had a lot of their tables sat.  I look forward to coming back, this is a very good restaurant, and you should be happy if you come here.

BOSJMKnLmcZEg8x58KFcCQ.text: Went here with my buddy Kevin today. I had the brisket and flank Pho. OMG on two counts, 1. the size was huge and 2. the flavor and quality was some of the best Pho I've had. I eat a lot of Pho when I'm out on business travel and Pho Aimie is on point one of the best ever. Very clean and super friendly employees. We decided this is our go to place now for Pho even though its a 20 mile drive for us. We will come at least once a month maybe twice. Something's are worth the drive.

oLSrC593QADHKmBdfqyKrw.text: Great place, privately owned and run by Annie herself. Unless you know the place, it is easy to miss but plenty of parking at least in the evening. Good food; I had the best chicken fried rice there; unfortunately the next time I had it, it was not as tasty and fresh, so they will have to work on consistency, so for now, I am taking back one more start... I will keep my review short since I have not tried too many items on their menu, but taking my roommate's word for it, it is quite good altogether...

1b5MQO5dAQdwFGOZdLCbhw.text: Love this place! They have a very friendly and attentive staff. Pho was amazing and I'm sad I don't live here otherwise this would be my go-to.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qtp0xM7SVNccgGjXAWVTiA.text: Came here with a large group of 24 -  all from Las Vegas and all have had pho many times before.  The pho was delicious.  Great flavor and large portions.  Everyone that had the pho agreed it was some of the best we've ever had.  Other items that we had were spring rolls - freshly made, combination fried rice - very good, pork chop - came with rice and fried egg.  There were no complaints with the food and service was spot on throughout.  As an added bonus prices are very reasonable.  There are many pho restaurants in the southwest part of town but this is the best we've been to.  The consensus was we would definitely return in the future.

46LNfIa5n-RPU5ASQCsQYw.text: Love this place food is always good  never once had a problem with service they are always respectful and professional and the prices are very good at all so you can't go wrong

tXt2Gb6ISrBGUpA8buHrgw.text: Quick service, very friendly waiters, and food is good! The waiters here are always friendly and work well.  The food flavor is always constant. Which is important for me. The pho noodles are never soggy.  I have gone to couple other new phos around the area but always return to this one.   The only thing disappointing is thr  grilled chicken n rice.. The chicken always has a mild unpleasant chicken smell I feel like if they pre-treat the meat(by using fresher chicken/white meat instead of dark meat/pre-season with garlic or rice wine) it wouldnt have that taste. But we always get that bc my child doesnt eat pho.

0uiXS2Sdrd3BRNxZvhIxWg.text: For future visits, I will only be about the "Chicken Curry Noodle Soup" (CCNS).  I tried being a good husband and getting other items for variety's sake on past visits; it's my wife's favorite as well...that's over now.    The CCNS consists of a thick, rich, hearty broth that touches my soul like Louis Armstrong singing "What a Wonderful World".  It's easy to taste upon the first spoonful of this glorious curryness that it's not something that can just be whipped up.  Those chickens have been simmering in broth for hours, if not days.  The generous amount of meat in the bowl makes me love it even more.    Not that there's anything wrong with their rare beef pho or those meat entrees where the grains of rice looks all cute and snuggled up under the canopy of a perfectly fried egg, but that's all vice president/runner up type stuff.  Next time I order, I plan on just saying "Call me Obama and bring me that fucking awesome stuff in a bowl."

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry pho was outstanding
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rare steak with brisket
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg rolls

BkS9TM4yiIy7GeIwcDVNZw.text: I am a frequent customer of Pho Annie's.  I have never dined in but have gotten take out at least 8 times in the last 4 months.  They are quick to have your order ready and regardless of what day it is they always have it ready in the 15 minutes they said it would take.  The Pho is fresh tasting and very unique from other Pho places.  They also accept credit cards which the one closer to my house doesn't not.    The Pho is always great tasting.  We have had the Beef Stew, Chicken Curry,  Chicken Curry Noodle, Rare Steak and Rare Steak with Brisket.  They are all so tasty and had to choose on which one to have for a next visit.  The price is also very good with the cost between 8-10 dollars for the culinary treats.  Worth the drive to come here for their unique Pho's.  I just love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seating area
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Order Counter

84hr2vFAyeIATa4ACNmxfQ.text: A little bit of a commute from home but so worth it! Small restaurant, yet very clean. If you have kids that don't eat pho, they have tasty bbq entrees. My kids love the food here. EVERYTHING on their menu is delicious, affordable, and the portions are HUGE! Aside from all the delicious food, customer service is AWESOME. Very friendly, prompt service. Pretty much my go-to when having a pho craving.

0uH-CRaLv4vcRRy6I5Fhjw.text: In my option This is the best pho restaurant in our neighborhood. Very testy pho with large potions.  The beef was  tender and broth is testy. Prices are reasonable too.  Definitely will go back there.

n522z10XO0kp4noz-UCC3A.text: This is by far my favorite pho place. We always get the rare steak pho noodle soup. Everyone is always super friendly and helpful. Everything is delicious. I definitely recommend this place if you are interested in having pho!!

D8drUoMxyem_cTG0uU9hdA.text: Loved this place! My friend once brought food from here for a party and years later I remembered how good it was and stopped in for lunch. I have a toddler and an infant- instead of giving me nasty looks the server and manager were ultra attentive. When my toddler started acting up, they gave her things to keep her occupied. Let's talk about the food-AMAZING! I ordered two vermicelli dishes that my parents and I shared: Singapore noodles and a crunchy one. Both were beyond amazing. Fried rice was fresh and tasty as were the veggie spring rolls. I can't wait to come back.

qHDTTvPMPzMRTXo2NuO66A.text: well i went to this place 4 times in one week.. i think its safe to say they are delicious every time! the vietnamese coffee is incredible! They are always super fast with my order and always have very affordable pricing. They suggest things to me that I have never had before and they are always super tasty! I love this spot!

e9JNWCY7piTX-LBmcFiCGA.text: If you're in the mood for some Pho or some comfort vietnamese food and around the area, check out this little gem. The establishment is very small so if you're heading in during lunch/dinner rush hour, be prepared to stand by the doorway for awhile. The staff is very attentive though but with such a limited space, you feel like you're being rushed as other patrons will be staring at you just waiting for you and your guest to leave.  But as far as food goes, Pho is Pho ;) The meat is very tasty and pretty fresh. It's awesome to see the kitchen too.

UHK4CrqbDTl9KkGAIk_8Dw.text: For appetizer, I ordered the fresh spring rolls, which I had to remind them three times before they brought it out. They kept forgetting so our entrees came out first. By the time the spring rolls came out, we were already getting full. For dinner, I ordered a grilled pork rice plate, which is supposed to come with a side of broth, but they forgot the broth too! At least the pork was  tender and flavorful. I also ordered chicken curry noodle soup for another entree. It was good, except too thick and more curry than soup like. I also ordered hot tea, which was oddly served in plastic cups instead of a a traditional tea kettle and tea cups. Besides all the mishaps, the prices are decent and it beats driving all the way to Chinatown to eat Vietnamese food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry noodle soup
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork rice plate

iV1dgu-1QtUzCas98CiiCQ.text: I'm pretty hungover so take this review as you must.Ordered the spring rolls, thai tea, and rare beef steak pho. Spring rolls were fresh but the mint leaves slightly overpowered the rest of the roll. Thai tea was smaller than what I was used to getting for 3 dollars but it was delicious. The pho was very good. Broth was full of flavor and the noodles were pleantiful.   What can I say. If I was 100 percent right now this place would probably be a 5 star. Oh well baylife.

6bHFVPuLvL11EzdHJ2KAwg.text: Googled pho restaurants nearby, came up with Pho Annie, we ordered our food, mind you there were 5 of us, food was here within 10 minutes, food was hot and very very good, and the service was amazing. Coming back for sure

8Wp1DEy6FE4mUaMltp9eBw.text: Great prices for big portions! I was so surprised on how big my bowl of pho was. The rare steak and tendon pho was delicious :)

jQDcqPfCZnTocLvtaQI7MQ.text: Intimate spot for pho.  Selection of Thai food and pho soups.  The service is typical for pho places I have to say, but better than Chinese spots.  Just sayin!  The pork chop with broken rice and egg is a must if your not in the mood for soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork chop with broken rice and egg

mnoY2niNHfIE77ORMH-vAg.text: This was probably the nicest Pho place I've been to in Las Vegas. It was decorated with nice (but fake) lush greenery everywhere and made it look so inviting the moment you walk in. We ordered the steak Pho, summer rolls and pot stickers. I only tried the potstickers and I'm glad I did! Highly recommend this item if you come here.

1rmY9ZtjANiaYB8ibC1Raw.text: It wasn't great but it wasn't bad either. After reading the yelp reviews for this place, I decided to stop in since I'd been craving Pho lately. Walking in the place was small and I was seated immediately. They didn't seem to have an extensive menu but then again, you don't always need that.   I ordered the Seafood Pho and it came in a fairly quick time. I ate it all but it didn't blow me away. The broth seemed fairly boring and not terribly flavorful but then again not bad. I'm going to have to give this place another chance but I'm surprised at all the rave reviews. Maybe it was just an off day.

eDujpxbb5f_ra6UXKGL5zg.text: The food was delicious. I came with my boyfriend (so party for 2) & you really should know this place is not comfortable for a party over 6. Such small spacing but the food made a little up for it. I ordered the bf chow fun and egg rolls. But the spring rolls are soo much better both coming with 4. The timing was perfect but the food was a bit greasy. I also ordered the coffee with condensed milk and it was terrible! Too strong for my liking. But the lady there made me a thai tea in place of the coffee and it was Delish. Def enjoyed my self and I would recommend for anyone to try! (:

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spring rolls (shrimp) coming with 4.

szE5rW4xtB5G8m_GhXVdSA.text: Showed up at 10am.. Doors locked. Lights off. Sign on the door says opens at 10. So does Yelp. Guess I should've showed up at 1030. I was looking forward to it... Oh well

WqOnXiRXqfRrnao8eM6s4A.text: Love this place.  Clean, food is awesome (never disappointed ) servers are good. You can do pickup orders. It gets busy but we've been lucky everytime to not have to wait but never fails to be a full house after we sit down and dine.

rzk8w7Hm4HWvdzsz--juWg.text: Just moved here, looking for my go to place for pho to go. This definitely isn't it. Broth is bland, and they didn't give me any lime, herbs, jalapenos, sprouts, etc - just thick white onions and green onions. The meat looked very unappetizing. Ordered spring rolls and there was no sauce for them, just a bag of wet lettuce, cucumber, and carrots on the side. Iced coffee was good, but the food was not. Really disappointed as I am not feeling well and it took me all day to muster the strength to get up and drive somewhere. I won't be back.

veIcHLPGmG4h0clAwYpHNQ.text: The food is great and the services is delightful.  It's also pleasant to eat here because its clean and environmentally fresh.  Unlike some other restaurant which is worn-out and has some lingering smell.  As a visitor here from San Francisco,  I would definitely  recommend this place to eat whenever you're craving for some good o'le Vietnamese food that wouldn't hurt your wallet.   I wish I met the chef on this day because not only the food was served fast... the taste was right on the spot.  Fresh!

z0n_482r665zBRx_pC2UHQ.text: So whilst traveling on the Pho circuit, this out of chinatown eatery which is close to my house is a surprise.  The Pho is decent here, but the star is the Bun Bo Hue (spicy noodle soup).  Better than most others I have sampled in Vegas, the rice plates are good too.  The service for me has been fine, as I get waited on by Annie herself alot, I haven't seen that "other" guy.... but then again I'm used to the "service" from the asian joints so I am a bit more forgiving.... So in a pinch, this spot works for me, but give the Bun Bo Hue a try...and don't let the pork blood squares or the pig's feet pieces scare you, just try it.....there's worst and scarier things you could eat......  Ciao!  C

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Thit nuong Cha gio= yummmmmm!
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue to the max!
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun bo hue

HRdKuCFh6NjDnWdNDtLmtQ.text: There's an Asian older women who's the server there. She is so amazing and friendly. Probably the sweetest Asian server I've had in a long time. A lot of the restaurants in china town have the most horrible service but that's not the case here. It's amazing authentic Vietnamese food with awesome service. You just can't beat that anywhere!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing butter chicken wings, 5 season squid, Beef Pho, Beef curry pho, seafood curry, and thai tea!

SSnDF5rLnQZ0zMbi19nToQ.text: Let me just say WOW! This was so delicious! Not only that everyone is friendly. I was kind of intimidated to come in because I have a cold and was wearing sweats I thought they were going to make me feel unwelcomed instead they kept making sure we were ok and not only that they brought more broth to my table because they saw that my soup was a bit low on it and dry. This will now be our spot and we recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Pad thai
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian PHO
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken curry

d7qwp-QIDEWKQk8S03RL2w.text: Awesome place. Usually a return customer of the very popular Pho Kim Long, due to convenience. However Pho Annie is small but family owned, fresher and with better customer service. (not amazing but compared to Pho Kims usual carelessness is an A+)   Tried their chicken pho, meat tasted fresh and broth was definitely on point. IMO if the broth isn't just right, I'm not a fan. Would definitely come back.   Prices are also average and not high at all, typically pay 7 to 8 bucks for a bowl of pho

b_Sqe3Dmh6SoVexm-67E0g.text: Pho was very bland. I want to give them the benefit of the doubt maybe the cook was having an off day with the pho? The other dishes were tasty. My dad got a chicken and veggie plate and mom got the shrimp pad thai.

VXOLPwrw2Aj3baNhm6DDkg.text: I come here for the pho. And it's phoking great. I always get the 16, great broth and awesome flavoring. I haven't had a bad experience yet!

gj9wVXIrK-Bu6-ChfX-Qkw.text: Really good pho!sate/chilli with lemon grass sauce is sick!!!!.nice descent strip mall and fair price!

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is their secret.!!

6IlV_nNH0pzGNUqc9EmWeA.text: I very loyal to pho Kim long but didn't wanna drive all the way to china town so I came to pho Annie. I like that it's not super busy and no wait to sit, the bathrooms are nice, and the food came very quickly. The pho is very good, maybe even better than pho Kim long. And my server was very attentive, which I am not used to when going to eat pho. I definitely will be back :)

lP0a7wtO7ht1bbG4UVNRNg.text: Four words - chicken curry noodle soup!  A nice coconut-based yellow curry with bone-in chicken and noodles.  There is just enough of a light spice to burn a little but make you want more.  My wife had the shrimp mango salad - lots of shredded mango, dressed with some sort of fish-sauce based liquid, topped with shrimp.  Very good!  My son had the rare beef and meatball pho - he demolished it!  This place was less than a mile from our vacation rental and was a real find.  Lots of parking, but a little hard to find.  In the same parking area as Sparklings and the Lodge.

UOq2XDe7MtQ0Hy6XO-_2uQ.text: The food is alright, a bit the on the greasy side. I love the coconuts but I didn't dislike the place and the rest of the menu entirely

JFUI9Xi0DpmXkufLELoCUQ.text: I love their Mango Salad, its my favorite on the menu.  Its green mango julienned into pieces, topped with lots of shrimp and flavored with fish sauce.  I like to add in some Siracha to give it a little kick, yuuumm!    I got to try something else other than their pho.  By the way, their portions are enormous.  Every time I've ordered, I can only finish half the bowl.  So this time around, I tried the duck noodle soup.  I thought the duck was going to be the itty bitty pieces of duck, but these were large portions.  I'm talking fat pieces of meat on every bite.  It is served with clear noodles, the thick rice vermicelli.  I think next time I will ask for egg noodle or pho noodles because those noodles are hard to eat.  They get stuck together and when you take a big bite and try to bite it off, that wasn't really working for me so I just had to slurp up whatever I scooped up.  LOL.    Service is great here, they are actually pretty quick everytime we come here.  I definitely recommend this place.  They also take Credit Cards, unlike the restaurant down the way when you have no cash.

ob9w7wLF4GUx8cEysO6XoA.text: Love this restaurant! Food was great and the owner was very friendly. Love the pork chop rice with egg. And their pho was very good and come with fresh veggie! Absolutely one of the best in Vietnamese restaurant in town!

9PJXfeRREydhz0BdloCI1w.text: My favorite local Vietnamese food! Springs rolls, pho tai chin, pork chops, Vietnamese coffee(strong) are among my favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vietnamese iced coffee, pho chin bo vien(brisket and beef balls) &amp; com suong nuong Chung op la. (Pork chops, rice and to eggs)
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bun Thit nuong cha gio
Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N0Co97eQJT9LaiUn-4rQCA.text: This place is our go-to now for cha giao and pho.  The broth is AMAZING.  I had dreams about it the first night after we had dinner here.  The service is great and they are always busy.  Expect a slight wait during lunch hours.

N6eOw2X5XzYMsG2ef7UgjA.text: This is a little out of my way but I have to say this is one of my favorite place for some really good pho. The broth is really tasty without adding any sauces to it. The atmosphere is cleaner then most pho places that I've ever been to and the lady that owns this place sure knows how to treat her customer right. :) I have two young kids and she would never charge me extra for a little more pho on the side.

I84m5odonpoLod2sp5O_og.text: Finally found this hidden little gem! I've been going here for the past couples months, at least once a week! The broth for the pho is always consistent! Full of flavor and always fresh! The meats are fresh, veggies are fresh and the food is delicious! The service is amazing! I LOVE their pho and spring rolls! Yummmmmmmmmy!!!!

PHPjQbAK1cJYPrufGjoFyw.text: Food was satisfactory. Service was bad & the HOT tea was served in a plastic water cup!! (Same cups used for sodas & other cold drinks) Unbelievable!! The tea also tasted like instant tea! nothing special! Will not return to this place.

n9HZ164uddgcSbzzMpi-Nw.text: Pho Annie is my local favorite. The grilled pork and egg over a bed of rice is more than enough reason to come back. Our waiter was responsive and attentive. The staff overall showed a genuine sense of love for food and Vietnamese cuisine. This "whole the in wall" restaurant is a go to for authentic Vietnamese food for any occasion!

Y9TicXUQiSxPbgp9wXGgXQ.text: We are from California (L.A area) and was craving pho,  found this place which was perfect. Completely hit the spot. The egg rolls were delicious,  nice and crunchy. The well done steak pho was served really really well and tasty and the pork chop, rice and eggs was pretty amazing as well. Would come back if ever in the are again. Service was ok, they were pretty busy and don't seem to do too well under pressure but it wasn't horrible.

0c6ULAw6_NqBB2hYcw0cjA.text: My new go to Vietnamese restaurant in my neighborhood! Officially switched from Jennie pho...sorry :( they have more variety of choices specially for me (vegetarian) i loved shrimp mango salad! Can't wait to try more appetizers here! Place is pretty small so, if ur planning on taking big family around major lunch or dinner hours come prepared to wait for table a little though...

photos.caption: Photo of Pho Aimie - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp mango salad was very refreshing!

zA5KvraUhv4seOswcxvPuA.text: I usually get the Pho Ga, but decided to try the Chicken Curry Pho because of other positive reviews of same. It had a dense, rich curry broth and a generous portion of bone-in chicken along with the noodles and veggies you expect.  Needed salt, but that's no problem (better than too salty).  Overall was delicious. Recommended.

kiL2c1DoBL3-aN7jSkpvTQ.text: My Husband and I decided to try Pho Annie instead of our usual Jenny Pho down the street.  The Pho dishes we ordered were great but the service at this restaraunt was absolutely horriblee! I asked for lemon and the server said they didn't have any but limes instead. Those never came. I asked for napkins, she said okay but never returned with those either. Was not friendly and when refilling water would overfill so that ice and water spilled and didn't say a word about it. Overall the server acted annoyed like she was doing us a favor.These are just a few things that happened. Ir's such a shame, the food is great but the service not so.

n4sMFE4lsUm90-TxfawItg.text: This place has poor service.  They couldn't even add my bill correctly!! Ordered 3 items and he came back with a bill for  $57 for 3 items.  WATCH OUT FOR Soups are very salty or possibly MSG.  My wife and I almost passed out on the way home and our BP was sky high.  We either got the bottom of the pot or they are not stirring their soup recipe well enough.  Nightmare to consume this.  BE CAREFUL!!

8xuA7OUrcJIUr82d6GcFbw.text: Pho Annie is the best pho I have had in a long time. Service usually quick. Staff is friendly

Z3ZHaB7EX3Venj6rHyUEfA.text: Annie is always very hospitable & she's a hard worker. Former server now the owner. The Pho here is excellent. I am Vietnamese & am very picking when it comes to Pho. Everything I've had here is good except for the eggrolls. Tried it a couple time with previous owner when it was Pho Rainbow. It wasn't any good so I never order it anymore. Bun Tom Thit Nuong & Lemongrass chicken are my favorite. So happy to have a nice Vietnamese restaurant close to Mt Edge. Use to go to Jenni Pho(pho there is no good) but now I'm a fan of Pho Annie.

SK54NcGq1OUYD5WHRE-S3g.text: Everything I've tried has been pretty good. My usual is the rare stk pho. Place is clean and the staff is nice.

sxuDFphvi161FHxu-L60Wg.text: Finally a pho place next to my home besides jenny pho! I really did like the food compared to all the other pho places on spring mountain ( I've been to all of them).  The meat was very tender and kinda melted in your mouth. The broth was amazing and I almost finished everything in my whole bowl.   The prices were pretty standard compared to other pho places. The reason I gave it a 4 star is because my pho took forever to come out! The other pho restaurants usually have my pho out in 5 minutes. Annie took about 15-20. Nonetheless it was worth the wait and the service was pretty good.
